7gjIWXdaYStB2Vh0TKLUpw.text: Since writing my last review, this location has improved tremendously. Mind you, my last review was directly mostly towards a specific bartender who seemed to not know exactly how to make their signature drinks and lacked in the customer service department. Since then, i have been there a few times, and i can say I'm back to being a regular customer. After writing my last review, I was promptly responded to by the regional manger. They advised that the necessary steps were being taken to ensure my experience would not be experience by others or myself again. Since, I can honestly say the experience has improved drastically. Our server today, Anu, was amazing. We had him a few other times and he is super friendly and makes our drinks perfectly (cute too)! If you ever get a chance to served by him, you will be pleasantly surprised at his level of customer service!

sVe3p-_2DKgh6cZOw6QzDw.text: Had some great drinks here on Happy hours. Had the Emperor's margarita (try cucumber and strawberry combo) and the Dragonbite ( I think) really yummy? Also had the shrimp wonton tacos and Vegas roll. Service was excellent and place was clean! Ill be back!

CeUNyvdZo68HBv6y6qS9cA.text: I gave RA Sushi another chance after having a negative experience in a Tucson location and at this point, I think that I'm ready to cross it off my list completely. I came here for a birthday drink and snack (small order of sushi and dessert after having a meal elsewhere) and it didn't wow me by any means. The drink that I had was good, but that's pretty much it. I ordered a tuna nigiri (maguro) and the sushi order came out before any plates, chopsticks, or wasabi did so I had to sit there and wait for those to arrive before I could eat. When I was ready for dessert, I asked for an order of green tea ice cream and our waitress informed us that she would have to check if they have it, because they were out the previous day. Ten minutes go by without seeing our waitress, and I remind her that I had asked about the green tea ice cream. She apologizes, and five minutes later returns with it. This is a rather common theme throughout this experience at RA - the food is mediocre and the service is always lacking. Maybe the issue is that I prefer to sit in the bar area, which is open seating? Whatever the case, I think it'll be a little while before I return here.

mvtuV2tma-mxnLrlAGS27g.text: Happy hour is great! Food is good. We shared the calamari tempura and a few rolls. The server was very attentive. The hostess was friendly. I recommend this place anytime. It's somewhat pricey when not on happy hour but definitely good.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari tempura. Delicious.

Kucgthx99wpoK5_f1a-mTQ.text: Everyone is so friendly at this location. My husband and I come here only when there is a movie in theaters that we are looking to see but the bartenders always remember us and our order. We feel like regulars even though we are only here about once a quarter.

CK9WQM4VhD9VzT9ws52EXA.text: Happy hour is a RIP OFF! $3.75 for domestic bottles!!???? $4.75 for a Corona?! OUCH!!!!!!!!  Other HH prices are barely a discount.  Horrid TV situation. (Only 3 in a bar that seats 50 and can only see one small TV per seat)

-Rcvj-rxuJkQk9CUBNADEA.text: Love RA restaurants and the service and food are usually really good. This time, my boyfriend and I ordered the crunchy calamari roll which was okay (the crab mix seemed dry), the nutty chicken salad (good!) and two orders of yellowtail nigiri. Now, is both having been in the sushi restaurant industry and also being frequent sushi eaters, the yellowtail nigiri served was pathetic. The fish was skimpy, and thin, and one even had a tear in it from being cut too thinly. Disappointing. I don't expect RA Sushi to serve high end sushi, but I expect some kind of industry standard. Service was nice but overall the food was not up to par.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skimpy thin yellowtail nigiri

0tMAVstJ5MiLEYE69xlxoQ.text: So i came to celebrate with some friends & the waitress was really rude. She didn't even come ask "if we needed or wanted anything to drink." Until, her manager came by she came to our table and asked & was still rude about it. And when the manager came to ask if we wanted anything I started to tell him our drink orders and he interrupt me and says hold on I need to drop this off and walks off! And then the waitress comes back! Also since they wouldn't come to ask if we needed anything I walked up to the bar to ask for one and they said they will send a waiter! Pretty much it took a U.S. About 40mins to get our first drinks after we tried to ask 3 times!

o3wihdxaWkrKyrW0QuDoLg.text: Very dirty! The wall at our booth had food splattered all over it. Our preset plates each had a puddle of water in them and the highchair we requested was beyond disgusting so I kept my baby on my lap. Our food was decent and our server was very nice but the cleanliness factor left a bad taste my mouth.

2gmlGFfx5MIWidP3ThDpWw.text: Matt Rime was excellent server and we look forward to returning to RA and enjoying Sushi.  It's hard to find anywhere that has servers who give equally good care to the children as the adults.  Thanks!!!

n99aAGpoZSnJva_HmZoU3g.text: I was very displeased with my service I thought that it was happy hour when really I ordered three minutes before and the staff should have said if you wait three minutes you'll be able to save $20... definitely do not have the customers best interest in mind. Never coming back to this restaurant.

vghC9uYKthgRweEu2A1Q_w.text: Food remains tasty, service was far from satisfactory. Then we had to argue that the most expensive third of my husband's order never showed up. I was done with my meal before he received his first plate.   May come again, but forget weekends.

yzD3VsxCqhZgC0QKhibBKg.text: I have been to Ra many times and it's usually very consistent with a great atmosphere.  When I visited this location everything was pretty much okay although the tables could've been a little bit more cleaner, smudging and spreading the food on the table does not really make it cleaner! The food is great as usual BUT the reason why they got the two stars and disturbed me the most was when we left I saw one of the sushi chefs working with no gloves!!! He served sushi, cut veggies, handling the ginger and the food with HIS BARE HANDS!!! Non of the managers/ staff or waitresses didn't say anything or just didn't care!! I still love Ra and will probably go back no question about it but not to this location!!

dBMNfnjmqSk7fkZ3XQZS6Q.text: They have a good happy hour and some very good rolls. Sake Bomber, Viva Las Vegas Roll and the Crazy Monkey rolls are my staples here. The ambiance is trendy and hip. Bar side is always a bit loud,if you want a conversation, try the resurant side.

O8aKLihKD2hwjKkNqu-wOA.text: Ra is a chain sushi restaurant so you know what you are going to get. Not the best, but certainly not the worst.   Happy hour is the perfect time to visit. You can get great HH specials both drinks and snacks, but don't expect the freshest or best sushi you have ever had.

jTPz5M0Uz-FALyQt3fTGnA.text: Pretty decent sushi for when I'm craving some. Love their bara chirashi bowl "most of the time" and garlic edamame. Service is a hit and miss. Sometimes you're just standing around waiting to be seated because nobody is in the front.    The boyfriend and I came in to grab something to eat right after the movies. He ordered the beef teriyaki bowl and I ordered the bara chirashi bowl. I wasn't given a fork so I had to request one. The one that our waitress gave me was dirty. She was looking at the fork and handed it to me anyways like I'm not going to notice it and walked away. Seriously?! She must of been deaf or something because I kept saying excuse me but she ignored me like she couldn't hear me calling her. I had to flag down another waitress to get a new clean one. To say the least I was annoyed.   On to the food. The boyfriend said his teriyaki bowl was alright. It was mostly all rice and hardly any meat. He only ate the meat and veggies leaving most of the rice in the bowl. As for my bara chirashi bowl, it wasn't as good as before but it was fulfilling and decent. Well...at least our water is on point every time we come to RA.

JBMpQW_LZ7sQoEHHxHt4aw.text: It's just ok, not bad, not great, but decent and convenient if you are going to the movies. Our server, Katie, was pleasant and attentive.   We ordered:  Viva Las Vegas Roll - pretty good Gojira Roll - yummy Pacific Roll - (I thought it was just ok, but the man really liked it) Spicy Yellowtail - usually my favorite, but there was no "spicy" to it :( Philadelphia Roll - (I usually don't like this one, but it was very tasty) Shrimp Tempura Roll - (I would recommend this one, but the tempura needs...some oomph!)  All in all, it was a nice visit and the prices weren't too bad.

TgDBeVTe8_up6pFvgIqdLA.text: My friends and I have a standing Friday night sushi date and we have never been disappointed with the service or the flood. Love this place!

jTalBPGSL91Gvj8OZXR-bw.text: RA is my favorite place to go for a date night. the crunchy calamari roll and the crazy monkey are so good! the viva Las Vegas roll is good too but it's a little expensive. the fried cinnamon gelato dessert is amazing! the music can be a little loud but the staff is super nice and will move you to a quieter table if you ask. the wait is usually only a few minutes. best sushi place in ahwatukee!!

30g2Qx1CFY_9YgicyZuEzA.text: Decided I wanted something different for lunch and what that entails for me is basically driving around until I see something that looks good and on this particular day, Ra caught my attention.  Luckily I was getting a late lunch that day so I knew sushi happy hour was going on!  The place had a decent crowd for 3:30pm on a weekday afternoon but I guess that's probably all due to happy hour, anyway I was able to be seated at the bar right away.  The bartender came over pretty quickly to see what I wanted to drink (water unfortunately as I had to go back to work afterwards) and let me peruse the menu a little bit.  The selection is pretty good, several different options to choose from that our discounted.  I ordered the spicy tuna which is always a safe bet and a couple different nigiri but I can't remember which ones right now.  Everything was good, your typical chain restaurant sushi but nothing to write home about.

9sJTdq3RWmkevOqjswr1Uw.text: Came to this RA (I frequent the mill location) and ordered a few rolls to go for lunch. When I bit into my avocado roll it was rock hard. The avocados were so ripe that it was inedible. And same with the cucumbers in the tootsie maki roll. I'm hungry and disappointed.   The staff seemed nice though.

6xBrT1YRuXD4WJ14qQaM0A.text: Only reason for a 2nd star was because the food was still good.  But definitely a zero star on the service   I have been here multiple times for lunch and the service is just HORRIBLE. SO incredibly slow. Even the initial greet was well over 5 minutes. Not to mention getting waters, the girl who filled water and such was sweet when she checked in on us. But getting the check and running the cards was SOOO slow. 8 minutes slow to be exact. That's a lot of time when people are on a lunch break. 8 minutes is the max it should take for food to come out of the kitchen, check should only be 2 min.  Now we are late back to work.   Don't recommend this as a lunch spot.

Hy65sPAxUmzlN4f3jetRSA.text: I'm currently sitting in another sushi restaurant right now. Do you want to know why?  My wife and I went to RA. We were greeted and sat promptly by the hostess.  It took a few minutes for our waiter to take our drink order. It seemed a little peculiar, because the lunch rush had already passed. There were only four tables to attend to, and I saw that there were at least 3 servers on the floor.  After waiting 10 minutes for our hot tea and iced tea, I told myself that I would get up and leave of he doesn't arrive with our drinks after two minutes. Sure enough, he didn't return within that time. (Which I think is pretty unacceptable.) Who knows how long it would have taken to get our drinks?  I didn't even want to imagine how long it would have taken to get our actual food.   So here I am, at a sushi restaurant a couple of miles away. I received my drink order two minutes after being seated. They're is easily 3X the amount of patrons here, and their service is still better.

A_8_Jxr4Tjqtr1dutcb0Gg.text: Not first time here , usually is better but this time took more than 40 min until we decided to cancel our order. And we didn't ordered some fantastic  dishes, just one soup and some sushi . Not even busy enough to justify the delay.  I was pissed off yesterday when happened,  but isn't fair to give them 2 stars,  after all every time we've been here everything was really good . Still ,  they need to work on  kitchen .

490W3LKmgJLbJVi_3dXE4g.text: Had a ditch day with my daughter and took her here as she has been wanting to try it for a while! Our waitress was super adorable and super attentive! I'm sorry I didn't get her name. The food was amazing the only reason I didn't give it a five-star is the portions are smaller and it is a little bit more on the expensive side.

38EhRzpnz8Vk3ppfsOVqmQ.text: Ate here for lunch. Food was average along with the service. Spotted a roach running around in the dining area. Needless to say we will not be returning

mRPh9xmjdR4FbyBZEkFXLw.text: This was probably the worst customer service I've received in a long time. Took them over 10 minutes to tell me they didn't have the ingredients to make the drink I ordered. After I said not to worry about it, the bartender then took the food menu & walked away. So much for having dinner here. This place is horrible.

5BCPp0MyHjrB_WTKLfRKqA.text: my family and i have been coming here for years. the service and quality has consistently gone downhill. tonight we went for my sisters birthday and the sashimi platter came out terrible, the manager james was terrible and didn't wanna help

rAnNpgNVWzq4rmTCMaHtQA.text: We were a party of 5 - came in around happy hour/early dinner. Getting a table (in a half empty restaurant) took forever, no one wanted to seat us?? Anyways, we ordered SEVERAL items; vegetable tempura - soggy, 2 California rolls - sloppiness doesn't even begin to cover it, 2 Tempura prawn roll - pretty good but showed up AFTER all our other food was gone and plates cleared. We also ordered 2 weird chicken kebab appetizers - really really bad, chicken tasted so bland and watery, yuck. The "crazy monkey" roll was actually very tasty and by far the best prepared item we ordered. Anyhow, the only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 2 is because after being seated our waitress was prompt and friendly - even though I think SHE forgot to put in our 2 orders of tempura prawn rolls and then blamed the kitchen. We won't be back - definitely not worth it.

QElDAJfWIKJYZItn1oJqMw.text: I usually don't give five stars, but after going to RA last night for sushi, I was very impressed,  despite the 3 star average.  I had great service and the food was top notch.  The only negative was the cost.  Rather high priced sushi, but that said, where else do you get fresh Wasabi, not the fake paste?  Yeah, that's right, that green paste is NOT Wasabi -- look it up.  As a side note, there was a cop outside this place watching people leave just prior to closing time.

4RgEPyJf994PCzsxoYAfnA.text: Sushi was great. Unfortunately though, the service was crappy.  We stood there waiting to be seated for at least ten to fifteen minutes and almost wondered if we're supposed to seat ourselves or just leave as there was no hostess at the front desk. Once seated our waitress had to come over two times in a row to remember she already took our orders and drinks order as she forgot. The sushi was great quality and absolutely delicious. The time for the check came and we were given someone elses check and had to point it out that this wasn't ours and then had to be given the correct check. So I mean not completely terrible just annoying in general.

6Cy5Q4Wmc2qdOk-afA6heA.text: Went tonight for my first time.  Wasn't impressed.  The server Madison wasnt attentive at all.  We had to ask for refills, we asked for sweetener 3 times before she finally remembered(about 10 minutes later)  our food took forever( and we went in at 430 so it wasn't busy) and everything came out at different times,  my sister was almost done when my kids got their food and mine came out about 5 minutes later. Food was decent, my salmon teriyaki was over cooked but edible. I didn't want to send it back and wait even longer.  When we were done,  i had to flag down the server to get a box and the check.  Over all, i wouldn't bother to go back.

kPpDV5qIkMbwWNwpNKymNg.text: The best! Its hard to find a good sushi place and RA Sushi Bar doesnt disappoint.

4FIEYGSSawV2f0QE_Z2RcQ.text: Warm beer. Weird tasting  green tea Brown salmon, still  connected,  maybe cut with a butter knife,  and  veins! Gross Overly pepper short ribs.  I get one date  with my husband every 6 months these days,  thanks for an awful time, RA.  The Rolls are good, but all your healthier options were awful.  Truly. Didn't tell our server bc  she was nice and didn't want to damper her night.

eX5UDWXkxsgIewVhpwfDmw.text: The drinks are mah-velous!!! And the sushi is fresh, never "fishy" smelling or tasting. The new California Dream Roll was awesome. It was a tempura style California roll, nice and warm, with a cool crab salad in the middle. And, with reverse Happy Hour starting at 10pm, the prices were very reasonable.  The service was pleasant, prompt and accurate.   Overall, the experience was very nice and worth revisiting.

Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jYeDssBE88rEiO-eEDVs2g.text: Alright, I really don't like to leave negative reviews, but tonight leaves me no choice. Really, there were 2-3 things that were really "wrong", but for us, they were biggies....   1. The menus were REALLY DIRTY. I understand that people touch them with dirty hands, but please, wipe them down. It is one of the first things we touch, and it doesn't give us a warm fuzzy feeling about the cleanliness of the rest of the meal/place if the first thing we experience is someone else's food /grime... Yuck.  2.  When our sushi items began to arrive, we realized that we didn't have individual plates to eat from, so we waited for our waiter to return and asked for plates to which he replied "we are running low on those right now, I will try to bring some out when we get some out of the dishwasher".... Ummm... This is a restaurant... How do you run out of plates??? I accept that it was a Friday night at 7:00, but there was no wait outside, and plenty of open tables inside the restaurant... This one confuses me... P.S... We NEVER got plates.  3. I won't say our waiter was terrible, but... He was certainly not great.. our glasses ran EMPTY a few times (more than once) and he was just lacking any measure of desire to be there at all.   We are longstanding Ahwatukee residents (20+ Years) and have visited this restaurant many times. Service had always been average, but tonight... The No Plate thing just really stuck with me.  Just because you are one of the few Sushi games locally doesn't mean that if you slack, people will continue to come back.   Just saying...

yVOP1mJNbw2JOgA0xEPbOQ.text: Pro: *Tasty Food *I ordered off of the "Nicky's Week" menu so my money went to a good cause.   Con: *I lost out on time at work because my 60 min lunch took 80 mins here even though it was empty. *My tiny bowl of Miso Soup cost $4.10

Qzw3fNBHY9lX4-UhrlRn2Q.text: Went to Ra for my son's 18th birthday because he remembered loving it when he was younger. We should have gone somewhere else. It was the biggest waste of money we've spent in a long time.  This place is all about the looks and a hip vibe. NOT about the food and service. My salad was not fresh and my Chicken Yakisoba was drowning is so much sauce it was horrible to eat. My Sea Monkey was good, but then this place is all about the drinks. The rolls were ok but this is not real Sushi. The rice fell apart in the soy sauce - the mark of truly great Sushi is not only the fish, but the rice you put it on top of. Even our old favorite tempura fried ice cream was completely cold (I know it's ice cream but in the past its been warm with a little melting around the edges). This looked and tasted like it was pre-made and thrown in the microwave.   The service was horrendous! Our waitress was attentive at first but then it got busy. She asked me if I had gotten a fork with my salad. I told her no and she said she'd bring one - it never came. She picked up my son's glass from his Virgin Mojito and said she would come right back and clear the plates. She put his glass back down on the table and off she went never coming back to clear our dishes. Another one of the wait staff did. We ordered a second roll and it took 20 minutes to come out. Then she told us she'd put the ice cream in and that it shouldn't be too much longer. At that point she left our check and it took another 15 minutes for dessert to come out.   My husband is furious because we paid $110 for a meal that wasn't worth $20. My son was disappointed and we are NEVER going back. In fact we are so upset we are going to do a redo so he doesn't remember his 18th birthday like this.  All looks and no heart!

_ANPU7s31Jaz7ERQN6Gluw.text: My friend and I went to RA, last night. We were seated and sat there for at least 15 minutes without any waiter or waitress acknowledging us or even asking us for at least water. We stayed for another 5 minutes watching waiters and waitresses pass us. So we got up and left VERY upset. Won't be going back with that kind of service.

DgM-hyO5z8EoCjEF_xsaCQ.text: I came here for lunch & had a bad experience. The food here is just ok. The service is horrible. They don't have enough staff obviously. My salmon isn't fresh. The shrimp is over cooked. First & last time for me.

zT7fkWoCxzo0RKGeZoOXIg.text: We love Sushi, so we frequent various local RA and Stingray establishments, regularly.  The RA Ahwatukee location is convenient to us and good for Happy Hour cocktails and food specials.  I find that while the bar staff seems cordial enough, they are not the most outgoing or friendliest we've experienced in other comparable spots.  However, the food here is the absolute standard of what a traditional RA establishment provides - Good.  Our favorite thing to order is the 'Tunacado'...This dish features perfectly seared Ahi Tuna surrounded by delicious slices of avocado & a side of the most amazing creamy Ponzu sauce under the sun!   Enjoy!

9xUTm_tvz60yrbhavyUJaA.text: It'd actually been a while since I'd been to a Ra that wasn't for drinks on a Sunday happy hour.   I was in the area with my boyfriend and we always go to this shopping center for the yogurt and we always pass Ra. I guess I couldn't remember just WHY I block Ra out of my mind until it slipped and I decided to give it another shot.  Bad idea.  It was a very very slow lunch, so when we walked in we were surprised to see no one at the host stand. We waited for a few minutes and finally a manager appeared to seat us. Our server appeared shortly after we were sat. I don't even remember her name, but she wasn't bad at all. She was probably the best thing about the whole experience - but that's not saying much.  Anyway, my boyfriend ordered the beef teriyaki lunch but he wasn't a huge fan. I didn't try it so I can't say much else about it. I ordered freshwater eel nigiri - hard to mess up, spicy tuna roll - also hard to mess up, but it was also nothing special - and a softshell crab roll. I was definitely not a fan. The roll had too many other things in it that contradicted the crab - I ended up taking out the carrots and asparagus - too hard to put in a sushi roll! I was so put off by the roll that I didn't even finish it. It was a pretty expensive roll that should have just been kept simple like all other sushi places.   For dessert, we ordered the banana maki. Again, it was nothing too special. Overall, I wasn't impressed and was reminded why I stayed away from Ra. I think they try too hard to make different and unique rolls that it ruins the flavor of it. I'll only go back to Ra MAYBE for the Sunday happy hours, if ever.

esHVwlpmzZnNhiRgwqgFwA.text: Whether it is True or not, eating at Ra reinforces my self-concept that ... I ... am ... COOL.  Naturally, there is a fifteen minute wait.  Cool people have to wait to be cool.  We sat at a table in the bar area and just had our meal there as you can order off the full menu and don't have to wait for your buzzer to go off.  Cool people don't have to wait the full amount of the wait time.  Happy hour lasts till 7 and offers an array of sushi and non-sushi items.  Cool people eat sushi.  I ordered the salmon and spicy shrimp nigiri and the pork gyoza just for me.  My wife ordered some vegetarian items and unfiltered sake for us.  Cool people get it unfiltered.  My items came quickly.  The vegetarian items did not.  When I inquired about this, we received an apology and two of the vegetarian items for free.  How cool is that?  Very!!  All the food was great, and the desserts are especially creative.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z4gQS09nN03hP8yRSDCSfw.text: Best happy hour sushi.  Most consistent sushi in town.  Always a fun place to eat. I love the Vegas roll.

qVzWVHA134K82_lz21uG8A.text: RA is ok.... I like to go to HH but if u don't get there early, it starts to get real loud. The food is usually great, the crunchy calamari roll is my favorite. I also usually get the Gyoza, Tootsy Maki, & Scallop Dynamite roll.  Prices are decent during HH... Last time I went the booth smelled weird :(

kGJjQgOO1X_ZJDGy2skQ8w.text: Delirious from hunger and unable to think straight I let my daughter talk me into the worst decision I've made in quite sometime.   We ordered a Tempura & California Roll Lunch Combo plus a tootsy maki and a tuna avocado roll rolled in toasted sesame seeds.   The tempura arrived, everything was barely crisp, a tad greasy but otherwise somewhat edible.   When we got our sushi rolls it was apparent with one look that they were total crap, however, starving as we were we decided to carry on and eat.   Tootsy Maki= DooDoo Kaki!   Don't be fooled by the long wait, they are not making these fresh to order.  This was definitely a roll that was prepped and pre-rolled last night!  The seaweed was chewy and slimy, the dried up rice almost broke my tooth and the crab mixture was like eating mayo that sat out over night.   My Tuna and Avocado roll which I asked specifically to be rolled in TOASTED SESAME SEEDS, was no better with it's also chewy seaweed and RAW Sesame Seeds, I didn't order a  damn big mac. WTF!   The California roll that arrived lastly with the salad was the same kind of pre-rolled crap. We ended up leaving it.   Unfortunately I had to pay for this shit, but made sure to thank the sushi guys for the worst sushi I've ever eaten and let them know that I knew they  had served us pre-rolled crap, and of course they had nothing to say but "have a nice day"!   *vomits*

4zNRq1OjGLgpHgGXEwTrSQ.text: This bar is based more on looks rather than authenticity of Sushi. Not that I have a problem with promoting ambiance, but I'm more about authenticity and dive places. Additionally the service was rather shoddy and IMHO rather racist. There was definitely a perceptible difference in  service to people of the brown leaning as compared to the paler people. I've been told that's a Phoenix mentality ( but I still thinks it's absolutely wrong).  As for  the sushi well the gaari was bitter ( a good sign that the place is unauthentic) and the slices of fish (which I ordered, tuna and salmon ) were too thick ( on the maki) and in the rolls too skimpy. Shushi doesn't have too many variables to play around  with so the way to determine its goodness is based on these parameters (also on the taste/texture of the rice). The lighting was too dim for a raw meat food joint.   The  servers were attractive though (again a sign that what they are selling isn't food)

VQe6k7jKzh2bsoQaqWCQ7Q.text: Decent lunch menu.  Great spicy shrimp roll & vegetarian roll.  Very attentive service.  However, for a quiet Sunday lunch with few patrons the preparation was slow.  Perhaps they were short a chef? Close to theater so maybe a post movie restaurant.  If you dine prior to the show you might be late.

AQ7h7iIjQWmHw9BA0WgXVg.text: For sushi in the desert RA is pretty good. I recommend the Vegas roll almost everything I have had has been pretty good. This location is not as packed as the one on Scottsdale rd or Mill if you're in the area.

7v9QYCP7rku0Oe7WzRFcGw.text: Its a dump. Mind you - a very nicely decorated dump. If you wish to hang out and yell over music with out much care what goes in your mouth then this place is for you. If you care about your food you should get in your car and go elsewhere, as this is not a place for Sushi/Rolls lovers. Its mediocre at the very best. Bleah.   "I dunt like" Eugene

uvxBtzXeOOezRNqI1Weybg.text: The atmosphere in RA is a bit pretentious, fake and noisy. But I actually like the place. I enjoy sitting on the patio, having a few happy hour asahi's and maybe having a sake bomber or two. I only do this when the weather is nice, and try to avoid friday's or saturday's.   As far as the food, I have eaten at several sushi places throughout the country and they all taste a bit fishy to me. When I get sushi I actually like it to be a bit bland. I sampled some of the more exotic stuff, and it wasn't for me.  So, for not being a sushi aficionado, by avoiding the crowded times and coming to RA's during happy hour times (7-10 i think?) I actually enjoy it!

gcv7vENx0asH23jdAkoM6g.text: I wasn't expecting much from a chain sushi restaurant but the food was surprisingly good. I love sashimi and only ordered a small amount because of my trepidation. I wish I'd ordered more because it was very fresh and tasty. The rolls I sampled were the Tootsy Maki, Spicy Tuna, and Vegas roll. Spicy tuna was my favorite but the Tootsy maki was also really good. I love anything with eel sauce. My husband loved the Vegas maki but there was just too much going on in it. I did love the fried lotus chips on top. Seriously, why don't they sell those things by the bag? The cocktails were just okay. Go for the happy hour because the prices are ridiculous afterward. $8.50 for a California roll? I think not! The service was extremely fast. Our sushi came out with our drinks. The wait staff were very friendly and answered all of my questions thoroughly. And, I enjoyed sitting out on the patio even though the view was of a parking lot. I'll definitely go back for more...but only before 7pm!

C4_90_15g03pNnkO_-lsng.text: I used to go to RA Scottsdale all the time when I lived in PHX and I loved it, and everytime that I have gone back since, I have enjoyed it just as much. I ended up at the Chandler RA less than enthused during my last trip to Phoenix because I had been there before, and it's just not the same..   Yeah, its the same sushi and the same prices - but it just feels more like a chain than the Scottsdale one does.. or at least, did.. I haven't been there in a couple years.   Happy Hour is pretty solid and we had a bunch of sushi and saki for a good price, so it's worth it during those times. After that, I'm not sure.. I wouldn't go out of my way.. like I used to do for RA in Scottsdale.

vGupgF05JGkiBibTg7td7Q.text: Great Happy Hour Specials. 3pm - 7pm Mon - Saturday.  Tunacado was the best!!! Spicy Tuna was delicious, great endamame & seaweed salad. Bar was packed, but we found 2 seats.   I can't wait to go back! Great, friendly service!

TlJk9mcgqSenwj3kj2PgqQ.text: Awesome & best sushi place! Our favo is viva las Vegas roll, kaizen saviche in non veg; veg tempura in starter, veg tempura roll in veg-sushi!!! New cherry Bellini rocks too ! We tried sake, pinapple appetizer last time, which was ok, not as great as ones written above. Overall fabulous food, drinks, and amazing service.

HwY1LTgy32IHUSl32SGClg.text: Another decent Valley sushi restaurant.  Nothing to write home about, but it will satifsy a sushi craving.

q9yW1-FmBIFHDt7e9yIoEQ.text: A pricy place to grab a bite. The plating of the food is beautiful, but the portions are a little small for the money. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated, but I could barely hold a conversation over all the noise. I was taken aback at how loud it was. There was a DJ spinning as well and, to put it nicely, I wasn't a fan of his "skills". The noise volume absolutely smothered the meal and destroyed the atmosphere for me.

fuMH6-ZIOgFwhc6z7guqBg.text: Disappointing! WAY OVER PRICED for less than average sushi. They try to be too fancy with their roll by smothering them in nuts, fruits, and other things! Some of the combos are just gross! For example, my roll was suppose to have fresh tuna on it but it looked like they had mashed the tuna up and molded it like catnip on top of my roll! Then, our seared tuna was completely covered with huge chunks of cracked pepper and sesame seeds...that's all you could even taste! Nothing was impressive. For a $90 tab, I was hoping for at least average!

BasWYXmBsjnFdciR1txASg.text: This place has really continued to go downhill over the past few years. Unfortunately my most recent experience ensures that I will not be again. My friends and I popped by to enjoy the reverse happy hour a couple evenings ago. Now again, the service here is typically subpar, so my expectations are never too high. The bartender delivers a martini I had ordered, and I go to take a sip. Immediately I felt like I had just sliced my lip open. When I looked at the glass, there was a huge shard sticking out where it had been broken. When the manager, Danny Hutchinson (I demanded his card) came over, he was so dismissive, even though my mouth had been cut, and I had only taken one sip of the drink. He said "I suppose I can replace that drink you had. You know, this happens all the time". I said what in the world!!! I would have imagined that the manager would have been a bit more concerned as and maybe offered a round of drinks for the table for our inconvenience, but he said look I can't just be buying drinks for every table..... I was appauled. He actually had the nerve to get an attitude with me. Like I said, never again!

DdUe2wiH4D7xdPKIVP4BgA.text: Ra Ra Sis Boom Blah.. Ive tried so many times to eat here and like it since there aren't  really any other sushi restaurants nearby.  Its just not happening. Sure they have a great happy hour prices, but I don't think I should have to fish lemon seeds out of my sake bottle, or have little nats swimming around in my soy sauce. The sushi wasn't very fresh at all. This would be a great place to go if you've never eaten sushi before, so then you'd have nothing to compare it to.

QgXOZuyGnW69yES3p9Tang.text: Our Sunday night plans turned out lamer than expected, and RA's reverse happy hour saved the evening! All dressed up on a Sunday evening with nowhere special to go? Ra will do!  Sunday nights they 'transform' the bar in to the 'Flying Fish Lounge.' A DJ sets up right around 8pm in the corner of the bar and the beats stay bumping til close. Though the beats are nothing out of this world, it just spice up the bar area, but doesn't cause too much commotion in the restaurant area...  Drinks & food at RA are overpriced regularly, but as mentioned, for HH, you can't complain. The prices range from $2-$7 for both drinks & sushi specials. Big rolls like the amazing Las Vegas Roll & probably the shrimp tempura are $7, basic rolls like spicy tuna are $4, & I think the nigri is $3.. Hot sake - $1, Big Kirin beers are only like $3, & their mix drinks range, but are never that impressive.  That night I ordered two rolls (the toosty maki is always a winner if you like eel sauce) & some yummy Albacore appetizer and my tab was $19. My girlfriend ordered dessert, and it looked amazing! An asian spin on the banana split, it was served like a tempura sushi roll, but instead was fried ice cream smothered in chocolate sauce, whipped cream, strawberries, etc. looked amazing!  Oh Ra, you may be a chain but I'm glad to have you close.

BbTR29WaPXv_vz3VnK53UQ.text: Amanda was very attentive and made a very warm welcome.. Bar was a bit busy and she held her own and still checked up on me in a timely matter.. I'm starting to like this place for its vibe and customer service.. Food is ok but like the service much more better..

gJTMxrhTBYR_bngwpJWBuQ.text: The happy hour is legit, especially if you're on a budget but there's not much inventive about Ra's menu, decor, or dining experience.   I will say that I've never had bad service at any Ra, which speaks to a pretty good corporate structure and training program. Water glasses are always filled and if there's ever a problem with the food or drinks their people are quick to remedy the situation.   The music is generally pretty decent. Eclectic mix, with everything from Biggie and Beasties to Ramones and Zeppelin. Can skew a tad loud though.  If you're looking to blow off some steam after work Ra is a solid option. And if you're with a gal, she'll more than likely approve.

DEi-l-YC7EGHHPIIDwwbmA.text: RA sushi is wonderful. Every waiter/waitress that has ever served me at RA (any of their phoenix metro locations) has been wonderful. They're fantastic at making recommendations on sushi that you might like based on your taste and the drinks there are also great. I have never had anything there that I didn't enjoy. It has a hip and fun atmosphere and it's a great place to go with a group of friends so you can get different flavors of sushi and just split them.  The only thing that bothers me sometimes when I'm there is the volume of the music. It could be a little bit quieter just so conversation is easier, but other than that I have no complaints.

Nyhj_draTBEbd8RbcJiKsw.text: RA is the worst place to go for sushi. They are owned by the Benihana corporation... so that should explain everything. RA is the Samauri Sam's for sushi. Test kitchen prepped with a marketing team to sell food based on quirky names for different rolls.  This RA is located in a shopping complex next to a movie theater. They have a decent bar and a great happy hour drink menu. That's about it. Don't eat there. Their fish doesn't taste very fresh and their rolls... well, they come out looking so fancy. But that's it. Just a pretty face.   Prices are a little steep considering they serve 2nd rate sushi. You can find fresher tastier rolls at Safeways.

-abfsgKdrjrYkwAO3qBV7g.text: Happy Hour- super cheap, good deals.  cheap sake, cheap beers, cheap sushi.  The downside- you get what you pay for.  The Sushi is made in the same process as going to a Subway.  Everything is wrapped in plastic wrap and they just plunk the ingredients onto rice.  White sushi chef re-wraps it a few time, "I think that will stick", and walla! Sushi!  Would I recommend the sushi?  No.  But I would recommend the sushi if you want cheap eats. Yes. Its' a little better than going to the grocery store for sushi, but not much.

iF4mwaLBNc27DzfrfiXhmA.text: Tonight was the first time I came to this restaurant. The whole staff seemed kind of down. The waitress we had was not attentive at all. The first drink I ordered was a pomegranate Mohito. When I got my drink I did not taste any pomegranate. all I tasted was squeezed lime. So when I finally saw my waitress seven minutes later I asked change my drink which they did with no problem. For the money we spent there I expected better service. The sushi was really good. I recommend the mango crab roll that was one of my favorites. If it wasn't for the bad service I would probably go back.

LQoDcR3TJt6QK8Hpys-Irg.text: I would highly recomend ordering a sunami punch from the bar.  I really really hate sushi, but coming here for drinks is well worth it.  Most of my friends like the sushi here, but for me the drinks are top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Store front

ANskVAfAIJ7iYu-t-FEiOQ.text: Food is always great! Tootsy Maki is always awesome. The music is always great. But the service... The service could be so much better. I came here with my daugther, sister, and some co-workers. I had surgery that restricted me to a certain type of drink. The waiter said I had to throw my drink away do to health code. I was fine with that so I put my bottle in my purse. I asked for water so I could add my protein powder in the water provided.  I was mid way finished with my drink and instead of her asking could she refill she reached across the table and refilled my protein powdered water with lemon water. WTF? Also the booth we were in smelled funky, like dish water... eeek! I will still come for the Tootsy Makie and Tempura Shrimp but I will make sure I always sit outside.

QBvspcB2O06oHmAlcG8CVQ.text: I like Ra, but their specialty drinks have never been very good. The food isn't bad or too expensive, but for some reason I just don't love this place. You can't smoke on the patio (might be some sort of law that isn't their fault), which is a main reason we usually choose sandbar for drinks instead of Ra. We come here for sake once in a while because it is so close to home, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat or have drinks here.

Xn9tSEPiRoZXouY16-7TqA.text: Went there a couple of weeks ago and was a little disappointed with the service. We went through 4 different servers within a matter of 10 minutes and had to ask 3 times for the little bowls for our soy sauce. We plan to go back, but hope the service is better than it previously was.

mzZysvXs-iEeGmkRcPHtGg.text: Ra has an EXCELLENT happy hour, and reverse happy hour on Sundays.  They offer  a lot of sushi rolls, and appetizers half off, along with great drink specials.  My personal favorite rolls on happy hour are the Tootsy Maki and the Las Vegas roll, but they offer several other choices so there's something for everyone!  They have great specials for Sake bombs, and the Blushing Geisha is the tastiest drink they serve (think, raspberry lemonade, spiked).  It's a great environment to go with friends, especially on a Sunday night when they have a DJ spinnin.  Not to mention, the food is delicious.  If you have not tried the Viva Las Vegas roll, you MUST!!  It is incredible!  It has a really laid back ambience about it, and great food.... why wouldn't you check it out? :-)

ntn1nh5AxLDSkFN0xCRtDw.text: My first visit was good... I had the Hot Miso Soup which was delicious and filling. I also had the Ra'ckin Roll. The shrimp that topped it was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The customer service was okay, nothing wowed me about it. The atmosphere was nice too. Overall a good first impression, I'll be back again.

hqxff2LmraIH7kIS718ywg.text: We tried one of the new rolls the Pacific Roll and the Tunacado!  They were really good, nice presentation, great flavor, of course our 8 yr old is branching out from her California Rolls, so I only got a taste.  We also enjoyed the stand by California roll, rainbow, shrimp tempura and spicy tuna, all as good as the last time.

ilIZeuQDc4GFQL6IDlmirQ.text: I love Ra, everything on their menu is soo good. Went there on 8/10, again, great food. I have to say tho the waiter was a little pushy and or not the greatest, I always wonder if you get service like that when you don't drink. One of the Dinner's encouraged sharing (just like sushi is sharing) so my Fiance and Mom shared a plate (After asking if it was a good amount, assumed) and the plate was real small and not for sharing. Thank god we had some extra sushi and my Fiance had some of that. Out for a family dinner, we don't drink but we got appetizers and a lot of stuff. Usually the service is really great on top of the food but the service was minimal, 4 stars for great food tho.

fRGGCZBAaQ55OHaJZX5wGg.text: Went to dinner tonight and got horrible service, nothing worse than serving you a semi-warm overpriced beer in a warm glass. Food was ok way overpriced.

vzMihqnLOf2i0Ve1w-5S6w.text: While it is a chain restaurant, I really enjoy the sushi here, and they have quite an extensive selection of it.  The tofu dish is a must try, we order it every time we dine here.  Also, the best music selection of any restaurant I've ever been to.   Make sure you check out their happy hour where many of their sushi are half priced.  *doesn't serve coke products

x_uGB_AfAoKZpkeHX-ChjQ.text: If you have to feel like you're looking cool when you eat your sushi, this must be your place. I say that because it's always crowded and I fail to see the allure.  If you want sushi, there are better places nearby. If you want to go out and party, there are better places nearby. If you want to go out and party while eating sushi, you come here!   The sushi menu is incredibly gimmicky. Be prepared to hunt for their "dictionary" so you can see what you're ordering. The happy hour deals are decent- I like both the Viva Las Vegas and Tootsy Maki rolls, but they just barely resemble sushi. Aside from the sushi, my fiance always orders the Chicken Katsu and enjoys it (particularly the wasabi mashed potatoes), but that's the only thing he orders at any Japanese restaurant.   There's always loud music blaring and after about 5, drunk girls in the bathroom. I can tolerate this place when someone else wants to go, but see no reason to eat here on my own accord.

0p9G7bF4WL-AjetClFhcyA.text: Went here the other night for late night happy hour and the food was fresh and amazingly tasty. Their cucumber margarita was a thumbs up. The yellowtail sashimi on happy hour was great yet they could lay off the sauce. Other than that, shrimp tempura was lightly fried and delicious, rainbow roll was what I expected and the service was impeccable.

KSs8lWeJJm4B5mvTT4rPWA.text: Okay...I'm gonna keep saying this until you get it in your head!  You looking for sushi?  Why are you coming here??  Yes, I know it says RA "Sushi" - it also says "Bar" -- come for the drinks and atmosphere.  Really the sushi is not gonna blow any minds anytime soon.  Their reverse happy hour is always a delight since prices drop and the drinks keep flowing :)  Stay thirsty my friends!

iyRw3WnA4OGvITLEVrZb3w.text: This was our first visit to this location, we usually go to the one in Dana Park. Ra is always a good go to for some good late night sushi. We got seats right away, got our drinks and ordered some Lobster Spring rolls. I wish there were a few spring rolls for the price they were set at. However, between the appetizer order and the sushi roll order, it took about 15 minuted to place the order. There was only two other tables in our area, so it was a bit difficult to understand what was going on, it honestly made me feel like we were being overlooked. The ambience of this location was nice and welcoming. I tried the Mango Lobster roll and Crazy Money roll for the first time, both were delicious! My other half got the Crunchy Calamari roll Chili Shrimp roll, which were delicious as well, but the Chili Shrimp was spicy. From here on out, I think any location I go to, those are going to be the two rolls I go with.

Xda7frsx1IE0YYmG9MGjDg.text: I go out for sushi all the time and always thought of RA sushi as a fancy sushi restaurant. Today was my first time and the inside was very nice and fancy looking however the service was not very good and neither was the sushi for how much it was priced at.

NIvZi4KlpReFjAVi4izf7Q.text: Service was decent because it wasn't busy but food wasn't great. Sashimi of toro was ok but wasn't the best. The udon broth was flavorless. I know these places are known for sushi but I've never ran into a place to where their udon was so bland. Will not be coming here again.

N4iXpQ4SGpC1uzInO0pRVQ.text: RA is like a beautiful woman you see walking down the street, initially stunning, but as soon as she opens her mouth you realize she's ugly on the inside. Yes, RA sets a posh vibe, sensual vibe. We came during happy hour before a movie screening, and it was busy. I was excited about the happy hour. We ordered pineapple wontons, seared tuna, and crispy spicy tuna.  As soon as the food came, I was disappointed. The portions are so tiny! I'm glad we came during happy hour because I would never pay full price for the amount of food we ordered, which tasted alright at best.  Besides the ambience and service, I would've given it a three star rating BUT I'm not sure which dish it was, but I became extremely sick afterwards, running to the bathroom - twice! For that I have to acknowledge that I really can't return here and don't recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wontons, small portions.

xv7UyoASJaCg-VcAtX9ing.text: The food is great usually. But the service sucks. My husband, our 7month old and myself asked for a booth for it would be easier to have the car seat in there. They were cleaning one for us, great so we waited. Then this family came in walked in and was seated right there. My husband asked why we weren't seated first for we have been waiting and the hostess said "opps" and if we could wait for another table. There were no tables at the time for people were finishing up still with their meals. I was so annoyed. Completely rude. Very disappointing. There are other sushi places that have far better service than this!

NnD4gu-8ez1Z2aZhLBlA_A.text: This is a great spot for lunch. Inside, it has the traditional Japanese decor, with the option to sit at a table or at the sushi bar to watch the chefs. You can also sit on the patio if the weather is nice. The wait staff is above average, but they sometimes are a little slow in refilling water, taking orders, etc.  For lunch, they have a great special. You get a salad, miso soup, a California roll, and a few pieces of nigiri. The sushi rolls are very fresh, and the seafood is of very high quality. They also give you a good amount of seafood for your money. The flavors are also very good on most of the sauces and seasonings.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tons of sushi

oQtyIO20fGprrLutke2GKg.text: The scallop dynamite roll is my favorite dish here!   Also the Toosi Maki roll and The Las Vegas Roll.   The happy hour is a great deal for more affordable sushi with friends or family.   Great for birthday celebrations or just a casual lunch or dinner.

svGhxyR8ESRU4lAucA15lA.text: I had great experience! The guy behind the bar ( I think his name is Ivan) was really nice , fast and friendly!food was great! Totally be back when I am in town :)

LwkmJXyYArU2SOBLiyhqPA.text: Their Vegas roll is the reason I come! It is FANTASTIC! I don't think I have ever been disappointed with any sushi I have ordered, the only reason it's not a 5 star review is because service is not the best. The hosts come off as rude and the servers are definitely overloaded with tables.

_9zCT_xzqAk99DReU06pdQ.text: Its a great spot for a quick inexpensive lunch. My friend and I came here on a Tuesday for lunch and enjoyed the spicy tuna roll lunch specual which included a soup and salad. They had the perfect portions, though I would say that they could have added a little more of the ginger dressing to my salad which was basically dry, but our waitress was quick and efficient and brought back a big bowl of the salad dressing.  All in all the service was great and I would come back.

MA_YcSng6_14xvbo8q7m4A.text: Close to work so I walked over for lunch.  Got the salmon bento box.  Also tried a signature sushi dish.    Bento box was American size portions of slaw salad, lettuce salad, white rice and salmon in bed of green onions, carrots bell pepper and sauce.  Except for the rice this is a very diabetic friendly meal.  Much more quantity than I needed.  But I ate it all.    Sushi was fried crab roll with avocado and fried shrimp on top.  Sushi and some miso soup would have been plenty for lunch.    I will be adding Ra to my regular lunch rotation.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ra Ckin Roll - fried crab roll topped with avocado and fried shrimp.   Very nice.

etOh52itoOKceeHGV5zkvw.text: Just stopped by here for a quick bite before the movie.. they just opened and it wasn't busy yet.. the waiter took forever to come in between to check on us and it felt like he was giving us attitude because we didn't order that much.. the food was okay but their service just needs an improvement..

qVPNMfI1bZHXaeDtypV3zw.text: Had the best experience for lunch a couple weeks ago!  Devon was hands down the best server we've ever had. Anticipated every need and went above and beyond. Also loved that he didn't give me a hard time when I asked for no rice lol. We've had some bad service experiences there in the past but Devon is RA's saving grace! More servers like him please!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eKX9QOX2g2n8a9mug9K2rw.text: The four stars are primarily for the dark, cool, comforting ambiance and the consistently outstanding job done by the serving staff. The sushi is also commendable, better than most of the local sushi places which are mediocre at best. I just wish they would stop using those bland white papers to wrap the hand rolls instead of seaweed.  Update: they now give you a choice of soy paper or seaweed for the hand roll wraps. Yay! Plus their sushi has been pushing five stars lately.

ZBXJp89IWx-r5sI05AC4aw.text: Our server Michael gave us excellent service and was very nice! If you go during happy hour, prices are not too bad either. Fun atmosphere and cool ambiance. The sushi rolls look very appealing and interesting. The only issue I have is the taste of the fish that was on top of the Vegas roll (which is my favorite usually). It tasted like old fish and like they might have used left over fish from the day before. I eat sushi often, and know the difference between fresh fish and smelly old one. You can do better than that Ra!

A2C5FGPhh09FaDysEgCXJw.text: RA's sushi is definitely as good as most of the other places around here.  My only complaint is that while it's as good, it is also definitely more expensive. But the ambiance and service definitely make up for that. The servers have always been friendly and they are usually pretty quick to get food out.

z4Djq3o2JoAA6FC4nsMbvA.text: RA is amazing! We got the surf and turf roll and the Rackin Roll! They were amazing! Atmosphere is upbeat and fun for a date night!

92Eq7lvpSXybsukti895Zg.text: Had lunch here on a Saturday. A family day with hubby and daughter. Lunch was great the garlic edamame  is our favorite. We always seem to order the same things here. We didn't have to wait. Food came fast..

lus45fSMa_QPyEc9iKpwlQ.text: I ordered the shrimp soup, tuna roll and Chilli Ponzu wings. The food here is normally good, and today was no huge exception, except for a hiccup in the food and a serious attitude problem with the waiter (Mark). The soup came without ANY shrimp, not even one. When I asked the waiter, Mark about it, he dismissed it and said he would inquire about it. After an unusually long while, the manager shows up at the table, apologized and took the food away. Mind you, this restaurant is nearly empty, so no one should have been as busy as it took for them to respond. It took Mark forever to check in on us, and when he did he totally ignored me unless I said something directly to him. I don't know of he felt like I ate the shrimp out of the bowl or what, be he obviously had some sort of issue with me. I'm thinking this was a "one-off" situation with a server who was having a bad day, but the food was decent so it is what it is.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cIN0nipM5XYW23qOO7urOQ.text: We come here at least once a month. Today's service was the worst we have ever had. Madison was our server. I had to asked 2 other servers to get what we needed. Our food was dropped and she never came to do a check back. We were out of water and my husband just got up and got his own. I asked for the manager and Alberto came to speak with us. There was an apology offered and I thank you Alberto we will only be back because of the way you handled this situation. Thank you Alberto!

OxAIshfNjVuy21naPcVumA.text: Gilbert location is nicely decorated.  I like to sit outside on the patio during the nice weather because it's too loud inside.  The hostess was terrible - not inviting at all! - but our waitress was awesome.  The food is so-so.  It's hard to screw up miso soup, edamame and veggie rolls.  But the veggie tempura was terrible!  Dripping in oil and the dipping sauce was tasteless - or maybe overpowered by the taste of the oil.  There are DEFINITELY better sushi places but the prices are reasonable.  It's chain, keep your expectations low.

XX7fScf_9XczQ6VqpESqJQ.text: I don't understand what's to complain about with this place, ahem, previous reviewers!  Well, maybe because I went during Ra's Happy Hour Specials time, but I have to say, I was thoroughly impressed by their cheap appetizers and drinks!  My coworkers and I sat at the bar, amused by the waitress' t-shirts and the free condom "matchbooks" sitting in a huge fish bowl.  My tastebuds were immediately interested in the crispy spicy tuna roll.  This roll was effin fantastic.  I mean, literally, a mouth orgasm happened in front of my coworkers.  I mean, just because of this roll, I have to give this place four stars.  I also had the lobster spring rolls, which weren't as amazing as the crispy spicy tuna roll, but not horrible either.  Drinks were fabulous and my overall bill for two appetizers and two drinks was only $19.  Not too shabby, compared to other sushi places!  I wish this place existed in the Bay Area.

cCNeOYl2n1ZxTe6EMv5GyA.text: I have always heard bad things about Ra so I never wanted to make it a place to dine for sushi... I do think that most negative comments were referring to the location in Scottsdale if that makes any difference.  So what brought me to Ra was a team dinner with my coworkers.  The drinks I had were a little sweet than I usually like, but still good.  We were sat right away and the service was attentive... everything I had sushi wise was very good.  I enjoyed this much more than what I had at Kobe Japanese Steakhouse & Tepan & Sushi.  I would agree with other reviewers that the music is really loud and kind of out of place for a sushi restaurant.  In fact when we first arrived the music was at a normal level and then at some point they really cranked it up so then you kind of had to shout at the people in your party.  Other than that I really enjoyed the sushi and would come back for lunch since my office is close.

xNwXDH3UvZoBpiJOj88OGQ.text: I've read a lot of the previous reviews and I don't understand the people who are surprised that Ra does not serve the best quality sushi.  May I remind all my fellow reviewers that this is a CHAIN restaurant who opens restaurants in strip malls in the hippest urban environments.  Do you go to On the Border and remark at the lack of authentic Mexican Food?  No, it's a chain therefore it cannot truly be authentic.  It's a rule.  As far as chains go Ra isn't the worst I have ever been to.  Granted the comments about the consistency of the sushi are True.  I've had both good and bad experiences here.  Overall it is a unique chain that does a decent job selling americanized sushi rolls.  You won't find the most authentic sushi here, but the calamari roll, the Las Vegas roll, and the Gojira roll are worth trying, as long as you aren't expecting "authentic" sushi as some of the previous reviewers were.

zEo6OQGCbqayFE5XL0B7VA.text: i do not know why this place doesn't have better reviews. I have been here 4 times in the last 2 months and the service and food are exceptional. So good that I don' t even mind the wait. The Viva Las Vegas roll is like no roll I have ever had! must try!!

iyRry3nRMLjm1mkeyIr4kw.text: Why did I come here? I was visiting my friends in AZ, and we were trying to decide on a place to eat. I didn't have much of a preference and wanted to make it easy for my friends who have a 1 yr old. They decided on this place, so I went with it! Next time I'll speak up and share my yelp knowledge...  Don't come here if you want good sushi. This place is mediocre at best. Maybe they don't have great sushi in AZ given the lack of ports?? I am always weary of eating sushi far from the coast. Anyway, I got a rainbow roll and spicy tuna roll. My husband also got some nigiri and dumplings. The nigiri and rainbow roll was just ok. Nothing really amazing in terms of presentation. My rainbow roll wasn't rolled very tightly and was kind of falling apart. The fish wasn't the most flavorful. The spicy tuna roll was just bad. It wasn't real spicy tuna!! They just took regular tuna and mixed it with sriracha/mayo...wtf?! I can't comment on the dumplings as I have to eat gluten free (Celiac). My husband said they weren't bad. Everything else I mentioned was safe for me to eat.   We also went here during happy hour. I felt like the happy hour was just ok...they had a big selection to choose from (drinks and food), but the discount wasn't that much. I feel like they could have offered more discount or deals. The service was fine, and they have giant booths to accommodate large parties. However, I won't be back. I also feel like I need to go eat really good sushi now to make up for this bad experience.

Q2SJZTHSAVKnNC-xxFgJOw.text: Came here for a quick sushi roll the other night. Very disappointing. Sat at the sushi bar, service was nice, sushi chef was nice, hostess was nice; Sushi however was very disappointing. Ordered a rainbow roll and the lobster roll. The rainbow roll had little tiny pieces of fish on top of it and the roll itself was skinny.  Not even sure if the lobster roll had actual Lobster in it and again topped with tiny pieces of shrimp. The rolls were dry and tasteless. The sushi bar itself was kind of dirty, not having been wiped off properly, you could literally see the streaks of the dirty rag that was used to wipe the space.

bLdPPi8Mrik0iAdREeUEdA.text: I really love the atmosphere here. Really good spot for groups or first dates! Bar like vibe (there is a bar attached), you also have the option of sitting at a booth, sushi bar, or outside. Whatever tickles your fancy! Food is pretty good, I wouldn't say the best but this isn't the kind of sushi place you go to for amazing sushi, it is after all a chain. I really enjoy coming here and love the feel! You can hop on over to the bar next door for a prolonged evening or the opposite side to go see a movie, great location too.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sexy deep thoughts.

9Gq5RMp0vTqGtu8C3Sw7DA.text: Looking for sushi? Ehhh, this place has lots of choices but i think their other food items are better than their sushi. There are other places with much better sushi. Keep in mind this is a bar. Also, pretty spendy, even at happy hour alot of items are half price, but it's still expensive. Had two drinks, one roll and edamame and my bill was $35!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegas Roll

qxdPBLlXDqeXWggMXx2Vmw.text: Just leaving this place and management tonight needs to be fired.  Sushi has no color, no flavor and just not fresh.  The floors are dirty and all the soy sauce containers were empty. Now, this place wasn't busy today at 6:00 pm so everything should be ready to go.  I took my daughter to the restroom and it was disgusting.  Smelled horrible.  I can't believe this place is still open in Ahwatukee.   Seriously, the experience was disgusting and gross. I will never come back again.  Horrible!!!

WIXhCP1JNvTA56Vm2zoJ5A.text: Make sure you get there for happy hour or the shishito peppers go up an entire quarter. I guess they have redefined the term "reverse happy hour" where the business gets the deal. All the appetizers seamed skimpy. If trendy is the most important thing to you then this is the place. Average food, decent small serving size portions  = low value.

89sHEdV2k5Q2Ef1YzUB3wQ.text: This was a great lunch visit. Sashimi salad was perfectly prepared. Good was fresh and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster strawberry roll. Sweet and mild and so delicious!

CC0OOCA3RVbdBptAEDL8lQ.text: Date night on a Friday evening we came from CG and I said lets just get off on Ray Rd and eat some where random. Sushi was the pick. The atmosphere was awesome and our waitress Samantha was very attentive and helpful. We enjoyed 2 appetizers a cucumber salad & edamame wontons & Viva Las Vegas Roll & Tootsy Maki Roll a margarita for me and all under $50. We definitely will be going on. Sushi was great

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Las Vegas Roll, very tasty.
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber Salad
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tootsy Maki Roll

mdLW3JXRLGO3mykNw9Atxw.text: This review is for several different visits.  Ra is not far from the Boyfriend's place and I love that they have late night and a good happy hour.    Things can be hit or  miss here.  We previously came here for their 4 items for $25 and had nice service and good food.  Other times we've come and had smelly sushi (ahi tuna should not smell fishy) and my salad had dried up pieces of lettuce in it.  Not wilted, so old it was dried up and crispy.  Sometimes the staff is knowledgeable, other times they don't know what type of fish their summer special, Red Seabream, is comparable to.  The good has outweighed the bad so this is a 3 star review when it is closer to a 2.5 star review.  Other than the email specials/gift cards they send me and the late night menu, I would eat local for sushi.

UVnI28XKzADwzgHdJMigig.text: Great service and amazing food for a chain sushi restaurant! Enjoy the sake bombs and every role has a unique flavor of its own! Go to the ray rd location for a good time and a movie afterwards!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Las Vegas roll, caterpillar roll, sake bomb, and a damn good time!
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sake bombs!

W8UXHUh_hGrshdiBKGGrRg.text: Have had their food before and was very good. Have to comment on the service from the get go. Unfortunately tried going in today and waiting over ten minutes before leaving with no one getting my name for a table or seating me. Now, I would normally have no problem waiting, but being pretty pregnant and with sore feet it was a bit frustrating. Additionally a staff member did walk by and said someone would be by... That didn't happen and there are other good restaurants near by so we walked out. Hopefully it's better next time guys...

8bsSZw1wyom7fsOwKfAOLw.text: I visited this venue twice and I loved every bit of it. You cannot go wrong with edamame appetizers and some speciality rolls especially the scallop dynamite rolls.. Super delicious .. For drinks go with their signature blushing geisha. Not super strong but a good twist at the end !

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My favorite , scallop dynamite roll !
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried spicy crab rolls!
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar !

yeKOrl2X_mLj3DjiqpPszg.text: We had great service and great food. The bartender was really helpful in choosing sushi rolls- we went with the rainbow roll and RACKING roll. Good stuff! Recommend sitting at the bar; get a saki bomber too.

Wnq_Xcwe6N2zI54gHgfTmA.text: I'm giving this one star because I have to so I can leave a comment. This place is horrific! The service was poor and when I say poor I'm trying to make this PG. The cooked chicken was barely warm and our waiter was unfamiliar with what came with the meals. We spent half our meal thirsty because we couldn't even get water. When we started to sit down the tables were set but dirty. The hostess apologized and we walked from table to table until we found a clean one.....yet she sent no one to clean them. They had dried food on them and crumbs on the chairs. In the end, the waiter came to me and said he comped one of our meals and a half of another. After reviewing the ticket....he comped us for a meal we didn't even order because he charged us for a dinner meal in addition the the lunch meals we ordered. I've eaten at the one in Tempe and Scottsdale and had no problems. The health board should make a visit to this place as well!  I'd stay away from this place!

czB4k3tlj4egb_tG-8GUFQ.text: We sat at the bar for a quick drink and sushi before a show.  Once again great and attentive service from the bartenders.  Ra was having a current special of edamame and 4 plates for $25.  Great deal that is going thru the end of March.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy tuna roll
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crunchy calamari roll
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy tuna roll

XXMPte7HKHEtFRnd9vt55A.text: Love coming here for lunch - the bartender is friendly and attentive, and the tuna tacos are great.   The music is too loud and sucks, though. Like, offensively bad. They pump out dance tunes you might hear at the Gap - droning thump + auto tuned girl voices - the kind that make you wish you had been aborted.

RgYGz8pjsrhL4EoMJkZj5g.text: Not horrible but the worst sushi I've ever had. The spicy tuna roll was mushy like they put it through a food processor. I did not like the texture and have never seen that before. Rice for sushi was seasoned ok but the rice was a little undercooked. I got the vegetable sushi which was wrapped in some weird product that was not tasty at all. The dragon roll came with a sweet teriyaki sauce on top which would've been better if it was less sweet and had more ginger or sesame or savory flavor. The service was fine. The restaurant is kind of dirty and run down looking, very dark, obnoxious music. Won't return. I like supermarket sushi better.

QqmCZisv63cd-kC65FHLDw.text: They send out great coupons when you join their email club.  $20 on your half birthday and the occasional $10 off $20.  I like being able to sit outside on the patio at this location.  Happy hour specials aren't that great of a deal.  Lychee martini was just okay, though it was strong.  Pineapple wontons I didn't care for.  Avocado roll is okay... just what you would expect.  I really like the vegetable tempura.

xTg61py7F5ecjUsZmxzv7A.text: I've been to RA multiple times but never have we received as great as service as we did tonight. Christy our waitress and she was awesome. Great service and had a spunky personality. When you have a server that is personable and attentive, it always makes your dining experience that much better. Way to go Christy! RA, you have a great server on your hands.

KCULz27-FWDjiZq4jyTPew.text: I'm not sure I've ever been here when it was NOT Happy Hour. Still, RA has a great HH, and you should check it out.  Almost all of the appetizers are delicious and discounted. I think RA has some of the best Tempura dishes around. Their wings are tasty too.  Good drink specials...although their beer selection isn't stellar. There's always music playing in the background--different volumes depending on which day of the week it is and what area of the establishment you're located. It can be either dance-floor thumpin' or just background noise. Move to a different part of the restaurant accordingly.  Service is decent. Barely friendly (but enough), and frequently slow.  Overall, solid choice for an occasional Happy Hour. This isn't a regular stop though.

C5w0BFzSS1ALTqA7muLRMg.text: Everything is always fresh and delishhhh. Our server Griffin suggested the miso with white rice and it was AMAZING !! He gave us the best service.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Viva Las Vegas roll, Shrimp and Calamari tempura roll, spicy tuna and the philly roll

HKZSGBomKodZ47CGvptLOA.text: We love going to RA! We always receive great service, atmosphere and of course their Sushi. I love them all (we try new rolls with every visit) but if I had to choose just one, I guess it would be the Mango Lobster Roll. OMG... GOOD!!!

fMYgH21h8NJyJjWvmIkQDw.text: The server was friendly and attentive. My husband and I went because I got a $20 certificate off my meal for my half birthday. I had the best lunch. Of course, I ordered more food than i needed. The food was so fresh that we finished it all.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna roll
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soft shell crab roll
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari Shrimp Tempura

JqBjjBCbteSa1ldLxFBfvA.text: 2 words: happy. Hour.  Great cocktails and great prices on sushi. Service can swing between good and rookie mistakes but I've always been taken care of in the end

JZkmA57snWuuvCryDW5t9w.text: We used to be regulars here. RA used to have some great bartenders who knew how to take care of customers, but over the last 6 months there's been a big turnover and now realistically it's crap. Tonight the wife and I went in after the Diamondbacks game cause we're tired of the same ole fast food and I felt like having a few drinks in addition to some good food. We sat at the bar for 15 minutes and waited before just walking out. It's not like they were super busy. We would've understood that. We sat there and watched 4 employees talking and laughing with each other having a great time while we sat there just looking at them like, "are you going to serve us?" I think we may just be done with this spot that used to be our favorite place to go. They have one awesome bartender nowadays, Nate. If he isn't working we just won't be going there again. It would be nice if the employees took care of customers rather than spending all their time socializing with each other.

cjHoTEQ_XcbgtH_Kp6ssUg.text: I'm typically a big fan of RA sushi. This was my first time at this location since my gym is around the corner and it was convenient at the time. It took about 6 minutes for a bar tender to introduce the self and ask for drink orders, another 10 minutes to receive the waters we asked for and by then we knew what we wanted to order so we went ahead and ordered the food. Literally... 25 minutes for my buddy to get his 1st roll... and it then took 40 minutes (from order) for my poke bowl which was not what I expected- much smaller and not that delicious) and his teriyaki bowl to arrive. Once we finished... I had to ask the bartender if he put in the order for my Rainbow roll that I ordered with the other items- to which I asked to cance and close out since I was still overwhelmingly hungry and dissatisfied thus far. He gave me a voucher for $8 to use on my next visit since he felt bad. He was cool, but the place was so crowded that it affected our visit, our order, our drinks (which were refilled once in the time we were there), etc. not a pleasant experience and more of a let down than anything

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

L7h_krljImw68r8U8Cg4Rw.text: It's important to note that our service was great! I personally think we had the best server in the restaurant. We had two kids in our party and she was so patient and kind with them when they were ordering. We loved her! The new "RA" men is really bad though. I purchased the featured ramen which was $15 and had zero flavor. The broth tasted like nothing and the pork was mostly fat and wasn't seasoned or anything. I totally get this is a sushi restaurant and the sushi is amazing. But when I expressed the ramen wasn't right she took it back and I expected maybe a different one or to not be charged? Our entire party passed it around and everyone thought there was something wrong with that ramen. Anyway - great service and sushi! I just wouldn't order the Ramen.

A9buzVHnGCrktELblP3zQQ.text: We gave it two stars cause the food is still on point.  Tried the Gojira Roll and it lived up to our expectations.  Very Yummy.  That said, this restaurant needs help cosmetically.  We sat in a booth towards the back that straight up smelled like urine.  The vinyl on the bench was also torn up so every time they must have wiped the seat, moisture was getting down into the padding.  Needless to say, I sat in something wet and it was gross and it was on top of the pee smell.  Add sticky tables and a general emptiness on a Saturday night and I would have decided to go anywhere else at all.

Yb0M37XpZb6T1TDDgk2ydw.text: The sushi is sub par, only thing I really like is the Scallop Dynamite app. **I suggest always reading your receipt and charges!!* On multiple occasions, servers will bring out the wrong drinks/food and still try to charge me for things I returned or didn't ask for. Another time, my charge was meant to be $23, but when I got my card back, I noticed the charge was now $33! These servers are either always making mistakes, or always trying to over charge and get a bigger tip on top. Almost every time I come here I receive bad service, never had such bad service at any other restaurant. Tried other RA's and have had similar bad experiences. I only continue to go because my friends do

_5o9IIRBF2TtrScrDdj8JQ.text: I love Ra. This is the best place for sushi from east Mesa all the way to Phoenix. The food is sublime and the service is always terrific. The only negative aspect is that the tables can be wobbly. Other than that it's a great place to eat.

cQUgH16xAUzEfxD5_JV92Q.text: Stopped in for their happy hour (I do not recommend, unless you enjoy prejudice) waited 15 minutes to get served at the bar with an empty house. When my appetizer came(pineapple wontons) it was sub par. Then the roll came.... with no wasabi or ginger, asked the couple next to me how the got wasabi and ginger, they replied"it came with the sushi, funny how they got ot but I did not. After speaking with the manager he informed me that i was supposed to get the wasabi and ginger before the roll..... spend your mone else where the women behind the bar one was named chloe, I cant remember the others name but both are at fault. This happened on November 10- November 11 at 12:05
