DDVk7edGu5oVeguqtAjpPQ.text: I just want to say the customer service at this place was amazing. Not only did we have a good time, and enjoy the food but the staff was so caring and generous. They offered to get us a taxi and make sure we had a safe ride home. Definitely will be coming here again.

j29vK87PKvFJNwl_hoJoRg.text: First time ever at RA. Everything started fine as I had made a reservation and got sat in a timely manner. Once food was rang in we received all but one thing we ordered. Food was good! Which is why this is a two star instead of Zero. We were finished with all other food and drinks by the time the food we had originally ordered finally came. We had told the server we didn't want it anymore as we were ready to leave. He had told me he took it off our bill. When the server came he added it back onto our bill because he saw it had been dropped at the table. He then said oh so I can add it back onto your bill?! after we had said we didn't want it. Just kinda wow. What server would put food back onto a check that was clearly their bad and or the kitchens bad. Probably the worst experience I've ever had when dining out. I didnt speak to a manager but thought it should be addressed

7coBBu3HAJIl4JSw3KlVGg.text: I haven't been to RA in a couple of years, I noticed the menu has changed quite a bit and so has the quality, it is not like it used to be and it is sad because I do enjoy the atmosphere and reverse happy hour.

dXJ-haigFjSCNuexqtTwzQ.text: I have had the sashimi bento box twice because I thought the sashimi was stringy and weird when I had it the first time here. I decided to give it another chance because I thought oh maybe they where having an off day or maybe they didn't notice. So I went again had the sushi bento again and still bad sashimi it was hard to chew and stringy on the ends again. I am honestly only keeping it at two stars because I like the atmosphere and the wait staff seem genuinely nice. But the food like the gelatin like teriyaki sauce at this establishment is not good.

nmapkfXRHDrteRhuW_MAuw.text: Never disappointed by this RA location! The service is always great and there are always customers. The wait time can be long at times but it is worth it. Their happy hour is from 5-7 and they have discounted sushi and drinks. We ordered a lot of sushi and a drink and only spent about $50 which is a great price. We usually spend close to $100. My favorite roll is the crunchy calamari roll and the viva Vegas roll. The sake is also a favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

u8ws0aeFixIhh8dJflVADA.text: Sophia is the Absolute BEST server I have ever met. Such an incredible young lady. She's excellent at her job but she is able to relate to everyone she serves. She is genuine but adapts to meet the needs and personalities of her customers.   This is a gift that can't be learned!! She is on a path to management and huge success.

oXXsVwxGOZwuCzAdkMPQCA.text: We had a reservation for 6 people on a Friday night. We have been to this restaurant many times before and were never disappointed, but it had been over a year since our last visit. We were seated right away but at a table that was more appropriate for 4 people. The food was mediocare at best. I ordered Teriyaki chicken. The chicken was rubbery and tough to chew. The waitress took it back and I asked for the salmon instead. It took at least 15 minutes for it to come out. The salmon was fine but they put it on the same veggies and rice as the chicken had been on so they were now lukewarm. We also had sashimi. although the salmon was good, the albacore was cut very thick and had a fishy flavor. The halibut looked good but was flavorless and chewy. Finally, the server wasn't very attentive and we had to track her down several times to place our order, get more drinks and water, etc.

L7LK8xp1qLhMnd3ClbXgXw.text: I'm going to be very specific on what to order here in order to have the best experience. We get the pork gyozas, edamame, ichi uno salad, Las Vegas roll (the best sushi roll ever!) and pretty much all their sushi is good. DON'T stray away from these items though, and sure as hell do not order the new ramen (it's pretty bad). All the drinks are really good too! Love the red sangria and the mules. Oh and their happy hour is awesomely priced from 3-7pm

88RRAXCZtnz9JzWIijt_zQ.text: Was a favorite go to but last time there the salad greens had some brown on them. The sushi had too much rice and was loosely wrapped. My favorite hot very green tea wasn't green but more yellow and not nearly as flavorful. I seek consistency. Disappointed.

wZIFNkhFYBXeyj0JfkibWg.text: Very impressed with the service. Most RA locations I've been to have snotty service but here they really are friendly. Sushi was delicious a lot better than my last RA experience at another location. Came in during Sunday happy which I would recommend.

lP2VBnfFCqpcJDpKxUmZEQ.text: Ok. Let me be clear. This is typically our choice for sushi. Not because it's the greatest sushi in the world but because we like the service and atmosphere and can't go wrong  with happy hour menu. Tonight, we called ahead for party of 6. I spoke to Rachel who told me they did not usually take phone reservations but that she would oblige me because there was only one party on list in front of us. We arrived five minutes afterward-I was told we would be texted when table was ready and that they  would text when table available. We watched EVERY SINGLE PARTY be seated ahead of us and FINALLY received text one hour and 49 minutes after talking to Rachel. Sadly for RA, we already were at Ginban enjoying drinks and appetizers because we grew tired of watching walk in parties be seated before us.  Also sad for RA:  my boyfriend and I used to regularly choose this for late night, dinner, and happy hour. Now, I will NEVER spend my $$ there.  Not when I can choose from places with food and drink that compete and that pretend to value my patronage like Stingray, mido, or Ginban. Btw. If you drive two miles southwest into awhatukee, you will find a sushi restaurant that is just as good or better and where the staff value your patronage. Thanks Ginban. FU RA. You guys won't get a cent of my business EVER AGAIN. If I could give .0135 stars- I totally would. You guys suck. Your sushi is average and your hostesses don't know how to anticipate a mid size party. You pissed me off beyond repair tonight.

oHs1K7ACOWGEVNrBdlyNtg.text: I've always been a fan of their happy hour. Can't go wrong with their drink specials! I'm a huge fan of their pork gyoza and edamame. Great for lunch too! Ironic, since I hate all sea food, this is one of my favorite places.

d_QpGnLzOU97vqG2SMHSaw.text: We arrived at 4:00 on a Saturday and chose to sit in the bar so my bf could watch one of the baseball games on TV. The bartender explained that it was happy hour and offered the happy hour menu in addition to the regular menu. The happy hour prices didn't seem veery happy. $5 well drinks and $6-$8 specialty drinks. Food choices were also on "special" but comparing them to the regular price on the menu we found most were only discounted less than a dollar. In once instance, it was a 23 cent discount. The seaweed salad was pretty tasty but the rest was just average. The bartender waiting on us was more focused on two regulars or friends that sat on the other side of the bar than the other four patrons that she was supposed to be taking care of. When she would come around she was nice enough but definitely not attentive. Empty drinks, empty plates, long waits for food etc. there was a bottle of Japanese whisky that caught my eye that I asked about. She said that she heard good things about it. When I asked the price she said $8.50. I had her get me some on the rocks. I didn't really care for it, it tasted more like a scotch than a regular whisky but that wasn't her fault but I was a little taken back when she brought the check out and informed us that the drink was actually $11.50 (oops). With so many other sushi places in the valley, I don't think we'll be coming back to Ra. Oh well, live and learn.

qS9AeyLicfH8mR7RgW1SCg.text: RA is the bomb for Happy Hour! So reasonable. Their food is amazing and their presentation fantastic. They have Vegetarian options as well. Only caveat is it is always packed then, so you'll need to go early to get a table or two seats! They also have Reverse Happy Hour 10 pm - Midnight, Mon - Sat :)

VKskMmj7sW-bF8ZheK3R0A.text: Have you tried their happy hour?  You should.  I can't believe i like fish in the middle of the desert, don't tell my friends back at home in the bay area.  The tempura calamari is wonderful, please try.  Gyoza is good.  Sushi has plenty of the good stuff - wasabi, makes you feel alive.    Love the music.  Gets kind of loud, so if you're looking for an intimate spot, this is not it.  Good place for a celebration with lots of people though.  Very friendly service.

CZ3oWDry1RLDhV6S21uoHg.text: Ra is a tradition for us. When I get to "go home" to the valley there always seems to be a girls' night out. Great service and great food, all the time. Try their coconut creme brulee if you're in the mood for something sweet. You won't be disappointed! Prices are best at happy hour- of course.

T_Ijq7JrfoMzHFjuJxn9qA.text: Heard about happy hour so we checked it out.  1.  Substantial wait for all HH customers (40-60minutes) 2.  Our wait was longer than quoted 3.  By the time we were FINALLY seated, they wouldn't honor HH prices even though we had checked in a full hour before HH was to end but got stuck waiting for a table for an hour. 4. It was too loud 5. Our server forgot two orders We won't be back.

kXT1Ylk5Ax4QH8-upgAbfA.text: Service was great. Food was good, but not outstanding. I'll stop for a quick lunch or a drink when I'm close by.

RCmxYZz5GXxpkh-cNONCCg.text: Love this place, sushi has always been delicious, love the Las Vegas roll. Always order some the pineapple cream cheese wontons, they're yummy! Had an awesome waiter on Sunday night, was funny and always had out drinks filled, even when he accidentally dropped our plate he managed to make light of the situation, which is a nice change from Waiters that will usually get mad. Bathrooms were clean, and the music was loud but it was fun music so we didn't mind it at all, overall I love this place:)

5NbwiVcH_zQ63DXbHvoeEQ.text: Best place for sushi in Ahwatukee. Who doesn't love Ra? The last time I was there I tried their sauteed pepper appetizer. It was a little oily but was very interesting. Their sushi is amazing!

ES8xv7J6W9nm1juJFYrmiA.text: Had high hopes for this place. Great atmosphere but the sushi fell short especially con the prices. Most important part of sushi is freshness but that didn't happen.

rD4EwtEL-7THVMY2xy33fw.text: I'm so torn on RA. (I know. I'm a brave person, getting up and going to work everyday and functioning with such a heavy load on my shoulders.)  Really though...I feel like I should have outgrown RA by now, but I haven't. I initially went to the Tempe location back in the day when I was 18 and hated sushi (forgive me, I was young and stupid. Mostly stupid) and ate noodles every time I was forced to go there by my ex or my friends. Now I am pretty well-versed on the sushi world and eat it every chance I get.  No, RA is not the best sushi restaurant in town. No, it is not the most authentic. But it always draws me back in. The happy hour, the drinks (Umami Punch, you are my liquid soulmate), the special rolls...I can't help myself. ("I wish I knew how to quit you"...)  I WANT to hate RA, mostly due to the douchebags it tends to attract, at ANY of the locations (we live in 'Tukee now, so obviously we frequent this location a lot), but I still can't. We went a few weeks ago for happy hour with some friends, and it was busy (of course). No biggie, we sat at the bar and had a drink or two while waiting for our table. They told us 15-30 minutes and we realized it had been longer than that...went up to check on our spot and lo and behold, our buzzy-thingy was not working and they had skipped us on the list and because of this, have missed the happy hour cutoff. NOOO! I needed me some cheap dranks and sushi! We sat down, the waitress talked to the manager about what happened, and the manager came over and talked to us, apologized, and let us know any food we ordered (sadly not alcohol as well, but I understand why not) would still be happy hour pricing. Pretty cool, as some places would have had a pretty "oh well" attitude about it.  Overall, RA is like crack, and once you've had it, you'll develop a habit you just can't kick. Pass the soft shell crab roll, please...

uNX1P7VovA7-OSuVi-UHdg.text: I went here twice over the weekend, once in Scottsdale and once here in Chandler on ray. I must say I think the service is indeed better at the one on Ray, food taste more as it should here too. I had their vegas roll, totally delicious! I love the happy hour here more than anything! Ill be returning again and again...  I'm glad I finally found a sushi place that almost can hold it's own against the ones I frequented in CA.

xmRMI9T7nTVvixn-AYrFHg.text: What the heck is the vegan doing at a sushi bar? Eating kick ass sushi!   This is my second experience dining at Ra and it was a good one! The veggie rolls are great. Stuffed with avocado and asparagus and super delicious. My only complaint is that our rolls fell apart, a problem that my girlfriend has had in the past here and that we did not encounter at Ra's Old Town Scottsdale location.  I was notified that the vegetable tempura rolls were also vegan, except that they are fried in the same oil as poultry and seafood. There was no noticeable fish and/or chicken taste so it's edible, IMO. This had squash (I think) and eggplant and was served with an eel sauce (V).  It was really loud, being late night on a Friday. But our server was very helpful. It is pricey, though! Each roll we got was $6-7 and when you add a sake bomber you're looking at an expensive night. Looking forward to going back for happy hour some day.

Q8IJafaQMTjLv6kdwvhfbQ.text: I'm not usually the biggest fan of Ra to begin with but we go there every now and then for Happy hour for sushi.  We decided to go to the Awhatukee location this time instead of Tempe.  Parking is usually crazy because they share it with a movie theater and other businesses.   We were seated and ordered our drinks and all was well.  We ordered our food and we ordered 3 rolls.  It took them 45 minutes to bring out our rolls when we were starving.  They never take that long and it was just unacceptable.  Every time we asked our server to bring us something we knew it was going to take him 10 minutes to come back with it.  Our daughter was waiting for her cheater chopsticks so she could eat with us, and that took forever. Same with our bill etc. It was a pain in the ass.  Their rolls are pretty mediocre anyway.  They are never rolled tightly and they are tiny.  I don't think we will be visiting a chain like this in a while.  We will stick to a mom and pop sushi restaurant.

dfFE9bmzPIs8qEfJ_9p48Q.text: When you come to RA at this location you know you are going to get good, top quality Sushi and great service. The young lady that helped us provided us with good suggestions and timely service.  As for the food, what can I say, after I finished the last piece or sushi, I still wanted more. Our appetizer was great also. I would suggest the miso soup paired with the tempura vegetables.   The sushi was the next best thing. I was fresh, well prepared, and the gave us generous portions. We had basic sushi, (cucumber roll, California roll, and the Philly roll), yet they were as yummy as can be.  Lastly our dessert! My wife enjoyed the green tea ice cream, while I devoured a banana split concoction with fresh fruits, ice cream, and tasty glazes.  I would recommend you try this place. Indeed the price was good too.

FC9svBmpdPS-kzMT6k6k-g.text: I've been going to this Ra for the last 8 years but I haven't been in the last 6 months.  Today I decided to indulge.  I walked in and did not get the usual friendly greeting at the door...very disappointing.  I sat down while waiting for a friend and just felt the worst vibe from the waitress and the bartender who acknowledged my presence with a mere glance. When I asked for a glass of water with the lemons on the side the waitress placed the lemons on a napkin instead of a dish.  Needless to say, I was annoyed so when my friend called to say she was pulling up, I decided to head over to the sandbar instead.

jzvxHgzSNTQdr6etDNOXmw.text: I give this place a 3.5. I went here a bit ago for reverse happy hour. I had gone to RA on Mill Ave once, a looong time ago. I remember thinking it was good before, but I think it's just cause I was not so widely exposed to sushi and plus, the ambience - being on Mill, with friends, during college, and the beginning of a night out - was what made it fun. So, going to this location was all right. The sushi was decent, nothing too special. I did however enjoy the drinks. They had the ingredients available to make my drink, a Geisha Flower. And surprisingly, other sushi joints don't have some ingredients so that's what made, hence the 3.5 and not just a 3.

rvrEseeUS9kQ_H-DQbaifw.text: I went to lunch here at Ra on Ray 2/18/13 with a co worker. The place was not that busy at all (I can see why) We were not greeted by a server for at least 15 minutes. Then a bus boy walks by and we asked him if we had a server (it was supposed to be Nichole)  Then a manager comes by and sees us looking at our watches and all around for "Nichole" I see a blonde servers back to us a few times (Nichole) never even looks over at us. The manager takes our food order back to the kitchen. Nichole makes an appearance and before I can ask for a drink she swirls away. We ask the server from another area if we can order our beverages from her, so she takes our drink order. Finally my salmon carpaccio comes, luke warm, and the sauce is NOT the correct taste too much wasabi-mayo.... not even close to Mesa or Scottsdales carpaccio... my co worker gets her miso soup and is not even finished when "Nichole" walks up grabs the bowl and says "are you finished?" my friend doesn't like people touching her food while she is still eating... so she tells her to go ahead and take it. It has been 35 minutes now... NO drinks, and the rest of our lunch nowhere to be found.... So we just walked out... LOUSY food LOUSY service or rather "NO" service unbelievable   I was so shocked because I have never had a bad experience at the other Ra's     PS.... the portions were so small they might as well use smaller plates now :(

avDEaQryIjN6PIZ2bArmdg.text: RA is sort of like sushi for people who want to say they go to RA.  I don't know how else to put that.  I came here for reverse happy hour the other night after not having been to RA in more than a year.  I used to go to the RA on Mill Ave in college, but I have not really seen a need to go to RA since.  It is just OK.  It is nothing special.  It is a little overpriced for the quality, portion-sizes and service.  The sushi is just... meh.  The one menu item I did enjoy quite a bit on my last visit was the Crispy Onion Albacore, which was 5 pieces of seared Albacore in a garlic ponzu sauce.  It was pretty weird, though.  There were no pieces of crispy onions on it, as indicated on the menu.  There were only a couple wontons on top.  Strange!  RA is a little too young, too funky, too not-so-me.  The clientele at this location seems to mostly be young twenties, but maybe that is because I have only been to this location after 7 p.m.  Still, on date night it is convenient to go to a movie and then the reverse happy hour, which is moderately priced.  At least until Pita Jungle gets their reverse happy hour going next door, there's a chance you might see me at RA again.

tupp1ZCenPDGUyMFwG_yeQ.text: My now husband and I held our wedding reception (we had a Japanese theme) at this RA sushi location. Everything was absolutely magical. Richard, the manager, was infinitely generous, helpful, and patient with our catering. We were able to rope off part of the restaurant for our celebration. There was a designated staff of 2 or 3 servers and we could even decorate as we pleased. All of our 45 guests couldn't stop talking about how awesome the food was and how beautiful the decor was! Delicious and unique appetizers such as the pineapple cheese wontons and yakitori skewers and the delicious iced tea really won everyone over. Thank you so much RA staff for making my wedding day so special! You're "RA"-some! We will never forget it. :)

nmIJ1sOdXXv4aUiiSdoanw.text: This place is extremely loud and filled with 18-25 year olds. The waitresses here pretty much ignore you the entire time, and the sushi was unfortunately sub-par. I'll probably hit up another sushi place next time. On the plus side, the decor was nice.

fBngwLRF1UV5ZknDK_0faA.text: RA is a great happy hour spot and is pretty happening on a Friday night!  The music is always great and even when it's chilly outside, the heaters keep the temperature perfect.  The service is okay, pretty friendly, just busy.  I tried the Mango Margarita last time and it was delicious.  With so many items on the sushi happy hour menu now, it is hard to pick sometimes, so I just got my usual of the Spicy Tuna Roll and the Salmon Nigiri, and of course, always edamame!  The side of grilled veggies is also one of my favorites, a little on the spicy side, just the way I like them!  Go on your birthday and enjoy a full size Tempura Ice Cream dessert!  Plenty for the whole table to share!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Saturday afternoon, before the happy hour gets busy . . .
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari Tempura

mO6JFYtvkyQ5lAKt7ehB3A.text: This place is tied with Kabuki for the best Sushi in Phoenix, in my opinion.  Atmosphere is a big component of sushi in my book, and RA has nailed it - this is such a comfortable place to relax (we love the bar area). The service is typically great as well.  Our favorite time to go is during reverse happy hour after a movie as it is right next door to AMC.

b1RtTuIAR7OKz-E86pu3-g.text: Dorian our waiter was the worst! He forgot to put my husband's order in, kept forgetting to bring us things we asked for that are essential for eating sushi, gave us somebody elses bill that was already paid,  didn't offer to discount our meal when he screwed up our service. How is he still working? At least the food was decent.

5pWYxh7y9uUZTaAb1hZRzA.text: This is a regular date night spot for my husby and I. We like to have dinner there then walk over and watch a movie next door. The food is normally very good, safe and tasty and the drinks are great as well. However on our last visit our waitress totally messed up our entire order and brought us items we didn't order and forgot the items we did order. It took forever to get it right and it wasn't even a busy night so not sure what happened. It was a disappointment as this is a fav spot for us, but better luck next time.

C8p6CXUEurRjXdYBacb7Gw.text: Fab happy hour.... make dinner out of it! 4 rolls , 2 salads & a lobster wonton app with a divine sauce to go with... all about $40... including a couple drinks..  Yellow tail roll was my least fav.. just had a weird taste.. and I cant do sushi with a taste that isnt fresh... umm sorry not worth it.. but everything else was right on...so I didnt send back...  Waiter kind of complacent.. I hate my salads to come seconds before my other choices..  Decor I adore!

QRkvmOJtcCYlyvoEV0ldDA.text: This place is awesome!  Their lunch special is a good deal for a bento box that will satisfy you.  The people who work there are very helpful and patient with you.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lol.
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy tuna roll.
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon teriyaki Bento box.

tn-75_S73FrDOXwRhaIQPA.text: I live right by here and have been going here for many years now. Its great to go for girls night, date night, or just a group of friends. I've never been disappointed by service or food here! Drinks are always on point. If you have enough room for it order the ice cream cinnamon tempura. Thank me later!

V9J2wzMPrWFVSLNZna7DYQ.text: Seriously the best service I've ever received! Coming from out of town the server was so good! She has awesome suggestions for sushi beginners like me! And helped us out with just around the area stuff. The manager on shift was totes on point! He was so awesome and chatty... He even bought us dessert! Definitely will come back again

52bE9Qqs0J6WhQ0kpjuBhA.text: Gave Ra two chances.  Still do not like the atmosphere, nor the food.  What's with the loud music?  Perhaps it's management hoping that I won't notice how awful the food is by painfully triggering my eardrums.    The noodle soup, the title of which goes something like... $14 bowl of soup (I don't know, it was so noisy, I couldn't think!) was TERRIBLE.  I really can't expound on why I found it disgusting.  All I remember as I tasted the broth and noodles was a flashback of Warner Bros. cartoons where a character (was it Bugs Bunny?) was shoveling paper money into a burning fireplace.  Total waste of money.  Mom didn't like the soup, as well.    A coworker of mine and I met here for happy hour and tried many apps, which I do admit were nicely priced.  The low prices aren't enough to get me to return, however.  The one plate I remember liking, so much so that I ordered it twice (we were very hungry) was made of tofu.  I even wrote it down and asked for it at my favorite sushi resto, but they didn't know what it could be, much less replicate it.  Since I'm not much of a drinker, I cannot discuss happy hour drink specials as I only drink water- I rarely order alcohol because I prefer to eat my calories.  Sayona-Ra!

RoPlaqzQumRoac4RX0oebA.text: This place has awful service.  Awful, horrible, terrible service.  Every. Single. Time. We sit at a table or booth it takes 15-45 minutes between plates.  We still go because it's cheap and pretty good when you do get your order. We have found that sitting at the sushi bar  helps in getting your order all together.

PWRJvd6atLJLkehUwTlbtw.text: Never go for the food.  It's not that it's not good, it's just that it's okay.  Always go for the drinks and company.  My friend and I visited during happy hour and got out the cheapest ever.  Our service was good, not stellar, but good.  I think that if they had happy hour all day, it would be awesome.

juk-CnsdO78BUQV74EyMTw.text: I've only ordered the viva las vegas roll and the tootsie maki because i get full and they never fail to disappoint. Honestly I haven't even bothered to try anywhere else because it is so good.

HO-NG9eLpN8xQMCiStqBmQ.text: I've been here once. Couldn't justify coming back. The sushi dishes are rather small and dry and not very fresh. The prices are alright, should be lower for the quality that they are. The atmosphere is crazy loud, definitely not family oriented.

s-rq4gju9ds2inrysopWlg.text: I met Sarah M. for lunch today. I think Ra is an OK place for happy hour. decent drink specials and their crunchy spicy tuna roll is yummy. For meals in general, just OK. We both had the chirasha bowl, mine without rice with extra veggies (GD thyroid - I diet and still gain about a half pound a week). All tasted good but for the same price I would recommend Sushi Ken for something local.

LZNQ8oHcBAjCh9hf9PMxdQ.text: Fantastic dining experience! Food is delicious, service is friendly/fast/accurate (ask for Christie!). Big variety, so if sushi's not your thing, there's options.

BcqfYHNnRRl5nsksxG5k4g.text: Having been a server for years and having come from Oklahoma and Texas, I'm normally disappointed by the quality of many restaurants' service. However, I'm currently being served at Ra sushi by Madison -a classy, considerate,  polite, and articulate bartender who has a degree in journalism. Come here and give her a big tip!

8l0CMrI-auXzgCyenNctAg.text: Never had a bad experience at this place, the service is amazing. I would recommend the tempura rolls, California and Vegas rolls. Also a really nice vibe on weekend nights!

DPAdcbXUHXeSUW5WspCBTA.text: Went here to celebrate a bday. Love the happy hour on Sundays. I would try and switch up some of the offerings. Seems like the same Happy Hour menu for years now.

hydHTnwqNrKjbIqZeQcugQ.text: I called in my order at 12:07 for lunch: a salmon teriyaki bento box and a spicy shrimp roll. I ended up sitting at the sushi bar for 40 minutes waiting on my to-go order...and that doesn't include the 15 minutes I spent driving to the restaurant.   When I left, I checked my bag...wrong order of course. I brought it back inside to the hostess and waited another 5 minutes for it to be fixed.  When I got home, the food was all cold.  Extremely disappointing.

QLSfwBHpPR_fiHzAzLVPjQ.text: Had a great lunch with my wife and girls today, food was excellent and the service was outstanding!

3ghfNvTvunnjj7fKAtLm7Q.text: Great place for sushi. Not as authentic as some place but had great service and nice atmosphere. The rolls seemed pretty fresh but had a little to much avocado for my liking. The four of us dined on the patio and it was a pleasant lunch. Nice staff too!

OQ6MKx8VkpE8SecDMeiD_g.text: Had high hopes. Whole place had about 10 tables and everything came out in no specific order. I got my main course first, then appetizer, then my drink, then the pre-meal soup I ordered can after I had nearly finished my food. Food was at best average, with so many other Asian restaurants in the area we won't bother with RA again. Plus our server was Horrible we had to ask for thing 3 or 4 different times and she would say she was getting something and come back 20min later without it just scatterbrained.

E9JaXAptCGYFZnsZASg7zQ.text: Before coming here I read the reviews and many were negative. Decided to ingore them and go in without any expectations. I was pleasantly surprised. The service was great, the sushi was good and the prices were decent. I'd even come here again. Especially if you want to pair sushi with a movie, because the AMC is right next door. Have I been to better sushi places, yes, but this place is still nothing to sneeze at. Give it a try! And go for the popular rolls, you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left to right. Las Vegas, Crunchy Calamari, Gojira and the Crazy Monkey roll. You gotta try the LV roll for sure.

-njKZM2vgp51F8o0NZiu-g.text: I LOVE RA. I Love it. Why?  Because they are consistent. I know  that whatever I order will be the same as last time. It's not pretentious like other sushi joints...except during after hours when the DJ is there. All I want is fresh fish mixed with fresh vegetables and other fresh delicious ingredients. I have always had a good experience here. I can't talk about other locations but this one delivers. I like to keep my wife here for date night/afternoon. If you want to beat the crowds, go here on reverse happy hour like Sunday from three to close. Can't beat it. Everything is fresh and fast. And, I can sample many different items at half the price. What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seaweed salad.
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Tuna roll
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seared Tuna-AWESOME

S2klyBqSi2IIJSC36Bg2rw.text: Ordered trays of sushi for a holiday event, and it was nicely displayed, delicious, and ready to go when I arrived to pick it up.  My guests loved it and we were able to enjoy the party without worrying about the food.  I would definitely do this again.

w5zM5zfjm9T5MzXFcrJ0Qg.text: Came here on a Sunday night after watching a movie and the food was ok but our service was horrible. Our server Jamie took a while to get our water to us with no straws. We put in an order for 3 items. She brought out one plate then after we were done asked if we were waiting for anything else so I had to remind her that we ordered two other items where at that time she acted surprised. We asked for sauce on the side and when she came back told us that she forgot what we asked for. Then she brought a refill for my boyfriend but just placed it behind his arm without telling us so he almost spilled it. All together it was not a good experience and we will not be coming here again.

BQyQn0PWCkW5VN4BmWlW8g.text: RA Sushi is very good there salad that has different types of fish is very good and the dressing they use is delicious my mother likes that one that's how I ended up trying that particular dish. But me personally I really like there spicy tuna roll its really good, but don't get it if you can't take the heat. DELICIOUS!!!!!

1Z2t7oEtUo3UAeybw_kB4g.text: The atmosphere is great for date night, very comfortable. The only thing I did not like was how close they put my wife and I to other people. Other than being stacked up like sardines. That was the only negative aspect of this fine establishment.   I love the fact there is an outside to sit and enjoy the weather. Our waiter was awesome and knowledgeable of the food choices and had a opinion about good food choices. The food was spectacular and I am kicking myself in the butt for not posting our food.   The bathrooms were clean and toilet paper was plentiful. The price was well worth it and I highly recommend this very fine establishment to any couple that needs to get away for a night.

ho6avF-ayFkoNPxXdU4HEA.text: I'll preface this review by saying that I love Ra. They have a fantastic happy hour menu and their seared ahi tuna is the best thing ever!  That being said, I got a takeout seared tuna salad today and it was the WORST seared tuna I've ever had (see picture below). It's almost like since they knew it was to go they decided to use the worst quality fish because I wouldn't be there to complain or send it back (which I DEFINITELY would have).  I will never order takeout from them again. Try harder, Ra.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. WORST seared tuna ever!
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. WORST seared Tuna ever!

ULjW8nQwzwiND7GZbLgObg.text: Got here a little later in the evening and was seated quickly. The wait staff was extremely patient and friendly.   Didn't order any alcoholic beverages, they did have a green tea however while I didn't enjoy it my counterpart did. Food was great, I definitely recommend the wings, sesame ones in particular. The sauce is to die for. The edamame was amazing as well although a touch salty.

m48AT1MUSGVkdLabe1HuTQ.text: Servers were really nice. But I got the bill and realized I had been charged $4.20 for a tiny cup of miso soup, which was my fault for not looking at the price. But SERIOUSLY...? $4.20 for a half full tiny bowl of broth and seaweed? Give me a break  I got the Las Vegas roll. It was 5 pieces, and the price averaged out to $2.80 PER TINY PIECE OF SUSHI. This place has ridiculous prices, which is why it was probably so empty. The portions were minuscule for such a high price. I won't be back.

1Eq0UwufSAph188trsw4yw.text: RA Sushi maximizes what Phoenix is capable of doing when it comes to sushi. It picks a specific set of dishes upon which it perfects the craft of. Each piece of sushi ordered stays intact, and, while the fish isn't as fresh as it would be in other cities like Los Angeles or Seattle, it accomplishes what it originally set out to do.  I ordered the Rainbow Roll and then backed it up with a Sapporo. It was a good combination. Sushi has to be defined in terms of its form, notably if it can stay together in one piece when you pick it up with chopsticks. It stayed in one piece, each and every one.  The Sapporo was good too, it's what you expect out of a Japanese standard beer.   As far as the ambiance, the bar is situated on the right as soon as you walk in, and the main dining room is on the left side which is situated with the sushi bar. The windows are full body and give you a view of the shopping center parking lot. Not too glamorous, but in the desert, your options to view things isn't too diverse anyway.  Service was good, they were attentive and mindful of the tone set at our table, so that was good.   Would return, but I don't live in Ahwatukee and only came to meet a friend to discuss business matters. So we'll see.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rainbow roll and Vegas roll

aJLTbEAG3chyZSyu7sLIMg.text: Came here for lunch and we were not impressed. I work in the industry so I'm very understanding, but today's experience was disappointing. The sushi chef Ivan was super nice, he greeted us when we walked in. It was quiet, it wasn't busy, but our server Griffin, wasn't attentive & didn't really have much personality. My daughters drink never got refilled, and we would've asked but he didn't really come around to us.  We love Ra, we go all the time & have been to most in Phoenix area, and this one was disappointing. We still tipped him over 20%. Overall, the food is great, but not satisfied with customer service from our waiter.

NqXFaGv24EyKwn9r-V_wJA.text: my mom, moms friend, and I have made a tradition to do RA in September for mine and moms friends' bday. We absolutely love it! Such good rolls and we had a good server :) I think his name was Griffin. My fav rolls are the Viva Las Vegas (omg so good) and the Ra-ckin rolls. lol prob cause they're deep fried but that's beside the point. we also do the veggie and shrimp tempura which is amazing. mom did a bottle of Kirin and she loved it. we love RA and will be coming back here again! go during happy hour! they have some goood stuff on there.

mbws_pDsMkbh7j2d4TIGTg.text: I wasn't really excited about trying out this place but I was visiting from Albuquerque, NM and my family said it was a great place for sushi and.. They weren't lying. It was delicious! The staff was friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was great and the happy hour menu was awesome! I will return!

O2hOTY2_69kGLolkN39V0w.text: The service here is never quite what to expect. It's like the hostesses and bartenders a little rude or full of themselves and pretty slow when it comes to serving. Last time I was here the smell was so bad. I love Ra for the happy hour prices, but don't think I'll be back at this location for a while.

XaRjkuYHdaZm7Q34dfpP7g.text: I've heard good things from my parents about this place because they compare every sushi bar to this one when rating it. I finally decided to try it since it's close to where I live & now it is my regular spot, the service is great & the food comes out in a timely manner. The pricing is not bad for a nice restaurant, worth what you get. By the way the miso is the best I've ever had.

RRJ8NQUUtC9su-xWGg2psQ.text: Love the layout and the location.  Happy hour was great, service was great.  We will definitely return.  Clean restaurant and sushi was delicious!

tPy2f1nwTtj-gdmY32B10g.text: I typically have 5 star dine in service but I probably will not order take out from this place again. I order the chirashi bowl and it seems like I get less fish when I order take out. This last time it seemed like it was 90% rice 10% fish.  Would recommend dine in, but if your looking for take out then you might find better value elsewhere.

M8Tvq-5JeaM5ltMlWCaMXQ.text: I come here regularly because I really do enjoy the atmosphere and food. As a server, most of my time spent eating out is watching our server to see if he/she really does his/her job well. Unfortunately, service at the bar can be hit or miss. I often find myself waiting several minutes to ask for ginger, wasabi, or to get our check. However, sometimes I get a bartender that is really hands on and always makes sure I have everything I need.

DTbSqeUqGHtDM8klbil5bA.text: It was a Monday and we just had to have some Sushi. It had been a long time since we've been to Ra Sushi. It was long enough that we really couldn't remember if we liked this place or not.  So, we decided to give it a try. We were seated promptly, and had our drink orders settled in no time. I ordered the Chicken Udon, and we also ordered a selection of sushi. The shrimp calamari sushi, vegetable tempura sushi, and the dragon roll. The chicken udon was great. Plenty of chunks of chicken and a tasty broth, with perfectly cooked noodles. There was enough to share between us. The dragon roll was also delicious, with a great sauce drizzled on top. We were a little less impressed with the shrimp calamari and vegetable tempura rolls. The tempura pieces dusting them made the dishes really dry to eat. The vegetable tempura could have used a bit more flavoring to the ingredients.   We have some favorite sushi joints, so this one probably won't push them out of the way. But all in all the restaurant isn't all that bad. We definitely be back for more udon.

va6k2gvquT6zuU4pqmlYpg.text: BACKGROUND My friend, Eva, LOVES getting happy hour at this particular location, hence, we've been here countless times, and we've ALWAYS had a great time here. I've also been here on date nights, and solo, and it's a solid place to get sushi RA SUSHI BAR RESTAURANT Interestingly, Benihana Inc owns/franchises the RA SUSHI brand, along with 116 Japanese cuisine restaurants around the world, including Benihana Teppanyaki brand, and Haru, and was founded in 1964, by Hiroaki "Rocky" Aoki, in NYC. Now that there are five Phoenix area locations, including, Ahwatukee, North Scottsdale, Mesa, Old Town Scottsdale, and Tempe, it's safe to say the RA SUSHI franchise is going strong in Arizona. THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE My last experience at this establishment was last week after my dentist extravaganza. After 3 hours of dentistry, I thought I deserved a little sushi treat. At this location, I usually like sitting at the bar, although at my last visit, I sat at the sushi bar and chatted with the very charming sushi chef. Of course, I asked for my FAVORITE drink, the Fuzzy Momo Bellini, and sadly, their frozen ice machine was broken. Ughhhh, that drink is my highlight. Oh well, I tried the Pretty in Pink, and it was alright, but not a Fuzzy Momo Bellini. Since the Pretty in Pink didn't hit the spot, I got a Sapporo light. I also ordered the quail egg shooter, which came with sake, which was VERY DELICIOUS. One of my mainstay, must-haves, is the tuna sashimi, as the tuna is always EXCELLENT here. Then, I like to venture out and try some fancy rolls. My sushi chef recommend the caterpillar roll and the rainbow roll, and I picked the mango lobster roll, which were all OMG YUMMY; like melt in your mouth fantastic flavors. The servers are always very pleasant, this time I was lucky to have Bryana. Even when you sit at the sushi bar, the servers take the drink orders and bring out the items from the kitchen that don't involve the sushi bar. CONCLUSION RA SUSHI has a soft spot in my heart, since I've had so many great experiences here, so I admit a little bit of a bias. Honestly, this particular location is nice, and mostly 4 Star, although parts of the experience were 3-3.5 Star, mostly the decor. It's a competitive market out there with all of the new high end spots, so I need to be honest. For the non-aficionado, this Ahwatukee location of RA SUSHI BAR RESTAURANT is a solid place to get sushi. 4/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Plenty of parking out front. *For more information: rasushi.com

Vw3koaKSxKXuR27bNNFB4g.text: I love this place! They're always consistent with their food & their service. My husband and I always go to the movies here & we always come to Ra out of all the nearby spots. Great vibe & ambience

l0eZC_RKyhdJ3Fjkhkv2Gg.text: Normally I am never on this side of town. I was in the complex and absolutely starving and pleasantly surprised that  RA are opens at 11 a.m!!    I ordered the blueberry watermelon Martini to start, very crisp and refreshing. I don't know why but I decided to try a different martini and went with the mango. A little bit disappointed here,  the mango flavor was very faint and bitter, I was expecting more of an overpowering sweet flavor. Definitely wouldn't  order the mango margarita again.  I ordered two entrees. The first one was the tuna salad off of the lunch menu. I was a little hesitant at first but happy with the outcome. For only $7.90 it was a steal. The saled had seared ahi tuna with albacore tuna. The tataki and garlic panzu sause woken tast busds I never even know I had. The flavor was  literally explosive. The earthy greens, tuna and sauteed cashews gave the saled a fresh and crisp tast. No joke I think this is the best salad I have ever had in my life  I also ordered the crazy monkey rolls. Rolls come with smoked salmon, mango and cream cheese rolled and talk with avocados red tempora bites and sauteed cashews drizzled with mango and Spiel sauce I also got the spicy mayo and jalapeno smoked Mayo on the side.   When I got my order our there was no spicky mayo. When I took my first bite of the crazy money till I was extremely disappoint. With the description smoke salmon  I was expecting a smoky flavor however this is not the case at all. The role had a very overpowering fishy taste. Very distasteful. I also thought there would be a lot more cream cheese and they're all there was barely even a sliver. I will definitely never her order this roll again.  Know for the services. I'm a little hesitant about this one. My server was very fast but not friendly. Being 11am the place was dead and I expected a little more friendliness. When I had questions about CERN rolls instead of answering my question I was redirected to certain areas of the money. I personally thought this is a little bit unnecessary. Throughout my dining experience which was about an hour and a half not once was I asked how I was doing or if I like my food, to me this is absolutely unacceptable especially with our a being and nicer establishment. I would expect this kind of service from my local burger shop not 'Re. If my server bothered asking me a how i was doing she would know that i was not satisfied with what I orders.   For paying $51.8p I really do expect a lot more. Even have to stop at another employee to pay my tab.  Needles to say I will not be coming back to this location. Bummer to i just got a job in the complex and though this was going to be my go to spot for lunch.   Good things there is so many options in this area. But seriously I would talk to your bartender. Although she was not rude whatsoever and the food came out that fast which I appreciate. I just felt like I was an inconvenience and that I was bothering her anytime I ask for something.   For being the only Patron in the bar for the last half-hour there was no reason for her not to ask me how I'm doing and if I like my food ext, ridiculous. I guess only certain type of customers matter. But on the flip sise I am more quiet reserved type of person so I won't address an issue unless I'm asked how I like my food and how my dining experience was. But nevertheless I don't think is okeay to ignore your customer for over 1hr and a half.

EgCGXVAem5C9dkQO6M-FDg.text: We all know this place is a franchise. I don't want to be one, but it is.   That brings it way down in my eyes, but besides that I can't find anything wrong with this place.. in fact the food is good, the place looks good, and their Happy Hour menu is great. If not Happy Hour, this place becomes a fairly standard sushi place, from a price perspective - but on happy hour they have good food for fairly cheap. And anyone that knows my thrifty self knows that I enjoy a good Happy Hour deal.   The service was good. The waitress hovered a little too much for my liking, and in despite of this excessive hovering showed a little low attention to detail. Good thing the food quality is good. We tried a little of everything from their Happy Hour Menu and taste-wise it was delicious and enjoyed by everybody in our party.   I haven't been to any other RA franchise partner locations, but this one is big and nice. I mean I really was surprised in a pleasant way. I wouldn't call this place intimate - but it still has many redeeming features.

hmZsXplFjsMY6U5LXKoa9A.text: We still love this place; still come in all the time, still love the food and drink... But as we were sitting at the bar at 11:39, a gentleman came in to order to go food. The bartender told them no, that the kitchen already did last call. If your online webpage and the hours at your door say serves food until midnight... I expect to be served food until midnight. If I got off work, rushed over to put in my to go order 30 minutes before the kitchen was supposed to close, and then was told no... I'd be pissed.
