We won't be going back soon.

co7zvqDHXM-qrA3JZMfd-g.text: Went in for happy hour after not trying it for several years... HOLY crap what happened to the prices? The sushi was just so so and the prices were high, even on happy hour. We'll be visiting elsewhere for a sushi fix from now on. boo.

YlFMSRJm3nAEPXoMLr_Dpg.text: I visit this spot for the Happy Hour.   3-7pm.    The Viva Las Vegas Roll is pretty delicious & fancy if made right.  Sometimes, I've had it look like a disaster during Happy Hour.  Other times, it looks like a work of art.  it depends how busy they are.   But always tastes decent.  The music in the restaurant is uncomfortably loud & dark.  On permanent night club setting.  Whenever I see little kids eating here, I question their parents' decisions.  Even during Happy hour, their drinks are expensive.  I always go home disappointed by their cocktails... even with the discount... because they're just not good.  Stick with beer.  All in all, mehh... if you're really hard up for somewhere to go, it's an experience.

jzQ5CQTr5uV3r_yCPU5tKg.text: Went during happy hour today (Monday). The restaurant was pretty quiet yet when we walked in there was no hostess to be found. We stood there for what seemed like 10 minutes before the hostess finally appeared and what a negative nancy she was! Our server, a young blond guy, was much nicer and very attentive.   The food was good we had the tootsy maki roll, and 2 salmon  bento boxes. Bento boxes were a little over priced, it was after 3 so they were no longer on special for $8.75 but instead 11. I recommend the baby umami punch drink during happy hour wouldn't pay full price for it but at 6.75 it's not bad. Could be less ice and more drink though!   Overall experience was ok. My bf and I joked that a requirement to work there must be to be bitch-y because wow most these girls sure were! RA do some customer service training with your people and you'll be golden !

u4V8kjvFsuXfxO5WRw9DzA.text: This place went downhill. service and food wise. seems like they just don't care and their happy hour isn't as good as it used to be. many items no longer available and not much of a discount. Sorry but too many other options to choose from in the area. I won't be back.

oqxieql_B4p_SS6X_PcBfg.text: Order sushi to go. Got home and found that there is   no ginger or wasabi. Not coming again.

3BEzB_lRoGYT5-DDS3OksA.text: I have been to several RA locations and, in my opinion, this one is the best.  Probably have ate / drank here 40 or 50 times in the last 7 years.  I hands down love this place.  Don't know how anybody could not give it 5 stars.    The sushi has always been great.  We have never had a bad piece of sushi here - in fact my sake bomber and I consider it to be kind of the standard by which we measure other places that serve sushi.    Yes, the Kirin sake bombers are always on special, but I like Asahi better than Kirin and they have both, so I'm in good shape.    Additionally, the female employees are generally pretty attractive at this place, which makes it easier to sit and hang out for extended periods of time.  And there are usually a couple of dude bartenders that my wife can stare at a little, so she's placated.    The crowd is usally pretty good Thursday, Friday & Saturday nights, the club music type atmosphere is current, relevant and helps keep you in high spirits.  Finally, since the theater is right next door, you can people watch from the patio pretty easily.    Pricing is what you would expect for a place of this caliber and atmosphere.    Highly recommend.

fv97gwNPefMD4s1CI9cdCg.text: Delicious sushi and good happy hour prices!

wGkYNkik35gHKpYc9PahBQ.text: Happy about having Saturday happy hour! Rolls are great. Haven't had a bad meal. Been to this location a few times, service could improve with speed (bringing the check) but overall good and I'll be back for happy hour, as regular drink prices are high.

bES2L0KEwrp4c4I8Zno0ug.text: i've been to Ra a few times in Arizona and California. the chain is generally located in major strip malls so it's one of those places i repeatedly stumble on while shopping or trying to kill time before a late movie.   i think Ra wants to be known as a late night hot spot as opposed to a place you can find good sushi. there's always a great patio to socialize and people watch. the service is slow and confusing because you seem to end up with about 2 or 3 different people waiting on you. the last time i was here, waitress #2 poured our sake to the point where it overflowed. unless licking sake off the table is an ancient Japanese tradition i don't know about, that's pretty crap service. as for the sushi, it doesn't stand out at all. maybe the music made it so i couldn't taste my food. yeah, it's loud to the point where both your eardrums and your taste buds are numb.  like everyone else says, go for the Happy Hour and hanging out. but take only those friends who have perfect hearing and really loud voices.

QD1ErZwZl9mWn_4B8cOGGQ.text: Came for the Happy Hour menu (5-7pm) and although the place was packed, we were seated immediately at the sushi bar. Calamari app was perfect - light, crispy, and dry - not dripping with oil like at the Scottsdale location! Three rolls, two sushi and a couple of beer/sakes later and we were stuffed and only $36 in! All the food was super-fresh. Yellowtail was a little too cold, actually, had to let it sit for a few minutes. Had to wait a little longer than I'd like to pay the check, but that's because our server clearly had too many tables to handle - when the place is packed like that, they should schedule more servers to come in.

FBPR1yYj0j6KsvvnMYCA1g.text: I've never been a huge fan of RA but I decided to give them one last chance tonight, and it will be my last. The service was absolutely terrible and the food was mediocre at best. The waiter was rude and we were halfway done with our meal before he brought out our drinks. This was yet another bad experience at RA sushi and it will be my last.

H4nQKPWHBDavkNtUmmPL2A.text: Pretty good happy hour. Not very authentic sushi. I hate people who think the can say they "LOVE RA" but the only thing they get are the California rolls. If you're looking for authentic Japanese sushi- stay away. Fun atmosphere, pretty good service, cheap happy hour, but I've def had better sushi.

1hmuLQjnNfasaI9Zglv4og.text: This place has a decent Happy Hour but that is really all its good for.  Get there early so you and friends can actually sit together and put back whatever liquor and sushi you can before 7pm and prepare yourself to get going to the next hot spot.  Not a big fan of the lighting in there either as they dim it so much it almost makes you pass out when its still early.  The specials during HH are what really make this place any good, there does seem to be a lot of DB's floating around there as well.  I will continue to still hit this place up for HH occasionally but you won't see me there any other time.

-0MUanYC6HcB5drEckDoyg.text: My boyfriend told me that the sushi we had was the best he has ever had there and that we must have hit it on an ON night. We had the avocado suhsi and that INCREDIBLE... the california rolls were just so so. The people there were the most ridiculous part and made me feel as though we should have been heading to a frat party after our "date".

2LYYRkr3A21qq1b6CAbTFg.text: Ra is a great place to go if you're looking for a party-atmosphere to hang out with friends and have some sake. But be warned, if you're in the mood for authentic and fresh sushi and a relaxing atmosphere, this is not the place.  The patio, during the cooler months, is quieter and more enjoyable (and is a decent place to people-watch on weekend nights). They have a great bar if you're looking to socialize and have a few cocktails during happy hour.   The special rolls are good. I love their Ultimate Shrimp Tempura roll and their Ahi Tuna is good. However, the seafood is not as fresh as it could be. The prices are a bit expensive for only receiving decent sushi.   When you're traveling and don't know any local sushi joints, Ra is a reliable chain to go to.

LcwpUv2oQurNDQx_22Kgkw.text: We came here because we were excited about their extensive yet reasonably priced happy hour menu. Unfortunately, after eating here, that's the only positive I can think of.   The two of us ordered quite a bit: salmon nigiri, pineapple cheese wonton, short ribs, sweet onion salmon, crispy onion albacore, and kaisen ceviche. The waitress accidentally got us one instead of three nigiri so it came out in two orders. The salmon quality was mediocre, but each order didn't even look like it came from the same restaurant. Different cut, different portion, one with wasabi, one without. Just very concerning sign of quality. Both the sweet onion salmon & crispy onion albacore were sliced so small you could barely see the fish in the marinade. The short ribs and pineapple cheese wonton were nothing special, but also very small. The kaisen ceviche was the best dish, but it was clearly not real ceviche as the seafood was so well done it was obvious it was cooked beforehand instead of made with raw seafood. The portions were so modest we ended up ordering dessert as well, which was pretty mediocre as well.   I generally don't like to write about service, but it was just so blatantly bad here. We were seated at a table with place settings yet wasn't even cleaned. They were confused about which server was ours. Waitress confused our order. She spilled beer on our table, laughed it off and didn't even apologized. Later she would clear our dishes while putting other customers drinks on our table. And the restroom looked and smelled like it wasn't cleaned all day.   Summary: very disappointed after spending nearly $60 for 2 while getting mediocre food with skimpy portions and subpar service.

7Zkbi7Pv70hwjYZmTN6zGQ.text: We've tried the one in Tucson, but this one had a bit of a longer wait.  The food was still delicious though and we keep coming back!  I love the sashimi lunch plate.

_irjyjwMUZjeTKb3Bqpl6g.text: I'm a happy hour troll... I never go there otherwise but get a bunch of rolls half off and some beers.. can't complain a bit.

meRVwnw-yfbZlhHz70apdA.text: yeah, this is the place where pseudo sushi afficienandos go to feel like their really exotic food experts. if it's got cream cheese in it, it ain't sushi, and this place has cc is just about every roll.  happy hour is LOUD in the bar. not fun loud, but "let's crank the bad early 90s alt rock and top 40 emo rock as loud as possible" seemingly as catch all for the only demographics who will like this place- early 20s and late 40s and 50s who want to seem like they still know how to get down with the younger generation.  because it's ahwatukee (a "sleepy bedroom" community that is pretty affluent all in all and likes to be reminded), the crowd can be obnoxious, even more than this bar already is.  again, i recommend it as a place to go and be rowdy, not to eat great sushi.

cFzgMnv0frJ_5rjvBj-_sw.text: There are RA sushi locations in Houston, I don't care for them.  Bad service for overpriced, undeserved food.  Well, I had a to spend the night in Phoenix and hungry.  There were only two restaurants opened, Applebee's and RA.  Hmm...which to choose...I don't like either.  My friend suggested RA since he likes it in Houston.  Wow!  It was fun!!  The inexpensive sake bombs and yummy sushi.  When you haven't eaten all day and your first meal starts at 11 pm...it was heavenly!!  The bartender was super awesome!!

EvFbxOfd0JchOE1fCADHuA.text: Have been here many times and have never had a complaint. The sushi is consistent, the service is decent and they have a great happy hour- great prices on sushi and drinks.

XBBuwmwn0xIfq2o3rQcQJA.text: Good sushi, great service. The loud rock music and night club atmosphere was a little too much. Went on a Thursday night and was told it was really laid back. I'd avoid the place on the weekends if you are looking for a quiet relaxing dinner.   The sushi was just okay.  For the price you pay, I'd expect excellent.   A little disappointed.

mm7o4oBqcxEUSsWBXlpeiQ.text: I love this place, the best service out of any RA I've been to in the valley and the food and drinks are always good!

S3pJqsEFuK-XZ09-C5gLug.text: The sushi was OK. The service was horrible. Our waitress was too busy talking with the hostess to bring our drinks. She was reminded to bring us our drinks after the manger brought them out. On top of the HORRIBLE service, she got tried to overcharge us. Watch the happy hour pricing they try to make sure that your are all liquored up then try to pull a bait and switch on customers. If it was for the pure fact that I was looking at my bill they would of over charged me by at least $10. If you want to get sushi in Scottsdale downtown area, I suggest that you go some whee else or if you get Jessica with the red hair demand a different waitress!!!!

h47ZYJdJ98NMWPwEXP8v1g.text: Again this a love/hate place. I love it, me and my wife like to go here on a Friday night, we like the atmosphere and the loud music, sushi is good and they have a good happy hour.

1LoxaOlzZ7W6yaf307V_xw.text: Good service, good price, good food, and sexy waitresses. Safe to say ill be back.

uU2GeSTavjZQ54YmYNobrg.text: Went to Phoenix for my buddy's Rock and Roll Marathon, and on the day we were heading back to LA we decided to grab some sushi since it seemed to be on everyone's mind. Found that there was a RA sushi bar right near the place we were staying at, and so what I thought was going to be a decent sushi place; since we have one back in CA ended up turning into a horrible experience. To be honest the only good thing I remember about this place was the hot waitress and the green tea...lol...I mean the service took forever (which btw it was around 3 pm and no one was in the restaurant), so either we had some beginner sushi chef learning the ropes or they just decided to take there sweet ass time. If it weren't for the eye candy and the green tea I wouldn't be able to give it any stars, but I decided to be nice and at least give them a star for effort. Have fun for whoever decides to try out this place. Never going back that's for sure. =P

4XrA_fKrWSnxHkTvS9WIEA.text: Holy crap, people actually eat here?  The last several times I've been to this RA, I can gauge my level of intoxication between pretty buzzed to blackout-absolutely wasted.  As you can tell, neither I nor any of my compatriots make it a point to actually dine here, mainly drink.  That's right, awesome happy hour and on Sunday night it's Service Industry Night (aka happy hour on Sunday night).  The happy hour menu is pretty extensive with appetizers ranging from the standard california roll to gyoza, seafood dynamite, and coconut shrimp skewer things.  However, where RA truly shines is it's specials on alcohol.  Food may be ordered when the hunger arises concurrently with inebriation, but at that point it doesn't matter if it's just so-so or even sub-par (it's like having beer goggles, but for food, not chicks).  However, I can't give this place a complete crap rating because of all the wonderful drunken memories I've had here (the few times I actually remembered the outings/the first half of the outing).

OumZ1jYg67jHVhjSQEvKsQ.text: We have been to this location a couple of times  and have received terrible service each time. Once seated it takes quite a bit of time to be acknowledged  by the waiter/waitress despite multiple staff passing by our table. A simple "be be right with you" would have sufficed.   The sushi is good, but the service not so much.

0eczF975KBS7obdLsf8YQg.text: Love love love this place! Absolutely amazing drinks, attentive wait staff, nicely priced food, and quick service. There's always a manager to be seen, I talked to one of the managers (James) Who came by to take some dishes off of the table and ask us how our meal was. He was knowledgeable and professional. You can modify pretty much any roll or entree. This restaurant doesn't only serve sushi, it has things like chicken or beef teriyaki, yakisoba, Udon, and all kinds of delicious appetizers. The clam udon and scallop dynamite roll are amazing! Perhaps the best thing about RA is there happy hour, from 3 to 7 and 10 to close. their bar is fun and has a great atmosphere. Their lunch specials are fantastic as well. If you are a more experienced sushi eater, they have sea urchin, toro, octopus. As you can probably tell, I come here all the time. Overall, this is just a really great place for any time of the day.

-3Mqa5m__chq7xzXtPJRUQ.text: Food is mediocre at best. Almost every "specialty" roll is crab mix and cream cheese based, so there is almost no variation whatsoever. If you're looking for serious and unique speciality rolls, this is not the spot for you. However, if you're looking for basic American sushi (or California rolls) with a slight Mexican twist, this is a good place try.

iJmbwc1mKI2PBnQc0h8S2Q.text: I should explain I don't like sushi.  I have tried to like sushi.  I dated a guy many years ago who was really into sushi and he would take me to the best Omaha has to offer and show me how to use the chopsticks and mix the wasabi, the whole 9 yards.  I gave it the good ol' college try, and I just can't do it.  My stomach rolls over after a couple of pieces.  Well, I think that, combined with the fact that when he purchased his new 7 Series, I didn't writhe all over it like Tawny Kitaen,  made me less appealing.  Such is life.  Now I'm married to a man who doesn't like sushi either.    What was I saying?  Oh yeah!  We had a great lunch at RA between movies.  We each had the shrimp tempura bento box, which came with 4 shrimps, a spring roll, a potsticker, a salad, miso soup, and some fluffy white rice for $8.95.  Everything was delicious.  We also tried their seaweed salad which was nice and fresh.  The service  was great too.  We  had a few of their cocktails which if memory serves, were very tasty, but we got a little loaded and then went to see Gravity in 3D, so my memory is a little hazy.   It was one of THOSE afternoons.    I thought the lunch was definitely a great deal and would go back for that anytime.

KbiSAP7hyMW7HXYPeM_TYw.text: I come to RA Sushi quite often because it is so close to the house and if you want something quick it is perfect! We always sit in Heather's section because she is so attentive! She is also great at recommending new things for us to try and knows the menu very well. My favorite item on the menu was the Hot Ra'k, so sad it is no longer on the menu but Heather recommended the salmon and it was incredible! No matter how packed it is we always get great service in the bar area. This will always be a favorite spot of ours!

y68Q_zdyqFFEIXyT3PoRew.text: I love RA! We come here every Sunday to hear the great music from the DJ! However, this Sunday we came and there's no DJ! The vibe is just not the same anymore. Don't give me wrong the happy hour is good and the customer service is great! But it changes the whole vibe without the DJ on Sundays! :(

5SKtPY1Psy_msnyNJbMsQA.text: I was really disappointed with the service.  Our order took really long to get place.  We had to remind them about the orders. After we paid and waited 15 mins for our dessert, we end up leaving without it.

MRJqnjLt1OytOki3AtABTQ.text: One of my favorite sushi bars. The happy hour is great, the staff is always great. This is the best location in Az. Crazy monkey roll is delicious with mango sauce and cashews. They have a lot of good sushi specials.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yellowtail

f5HwIDZ-etpljW8RKpJgTg.text: Slow slow slow service,  quality of food not good. Couldn't even get our drink order right,  water with lemon. Waitress freaked out when I asked about changing a roll by one ingredient. Seriously worried about the quality of the of my food. Never coming back.  Update good arrived an hour later. No good. Disgusting... definitely never coming back . Poooooor service

6_2HRcTpIy071AaBQmO9nw.text: WHHHHHHY am I a glutton for punishment?! After going to the movies, we thought we'd go enjoy some sushi. RA was the walking distance option. After walking into the loud club-like atmosphere, we chose to sit at the bar for the experience with the Sushi Chef. After watching some children left unattended playing at the sushi bar; a server walked up and asked for our drink order. He then explained that since the Sushi Chef's get too much attention and "step on our (servers) toes we now order through us". (Typically if you eat at the bar, you order with the Sushi Chef and bypass the server). After ordering three sushi rolls, we sat and tried to have a conversation. The music was so loud and distracting that it took away from the enjoyment that could have occurred. All throughout our meal, we were interrupted by our server chatting it up about his personal preferences while reaching across us for the plates. I'm assuming that the manager didn't explain to the server how to clean up and not physically put your body on top of the customer repeatedly.  Overall, the food was bland and UNDERwhelming, typically priced and will not be tasted again by us. Thanks RA for reminding me that True quality is not something you shoot for.

QQJSL4dWVZ4Q6ZTmRRlhqQ.text: One of my favorite happy hour spots.  The happy hour food menu is strong and there are drink options for everyone.  The best deal would be the $7 Sake and large Kirin.   The sushi itself, while definitely not the best in town, is decent.  I've never had anything bad or regretful here.  The atmosphere is always enjoyable and if the weather permits the patio is a great group spot (or just for general people watching).    You have a lot of choices in this area so I wouldn't go here every week but I definitely would keep it in my rotation.

V2kYUF_c30qRnWJp-1k75g.text: The Awahtukee Ra is fabulous. Avoid the Mill location (unless you're just going to drink).  Overall I would order the non-sushi, more Americanized dishes for a great meal experience. The rolls weren't very large or flavorful.  BUT, their Happy Hour is fantastic and the plating is aesthetically admirable. One dish I particularly enjoyed were the mussels in this flavorful garlic and leek broth. I ordered extra white rice on the side and make a little soup and was stuffed. Super filling and delectable.  Also, their sashimi is nice, which I always find is the mark of fresh fish at a restaurant..  Happy and pleased. Keep up the good work guys!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Las Vegas Roll... I&#39;m ashamed that I love this so much.

HPG62E_DG8_LzLWHdH9XyQ.text: We got there at a very busy time but there was no excuse for getting two of our plates to us real fast and or other place which we ask for twice and were told it was getting prepared was never given to us. We decided we didn't want it because it was a half an hour later and decided to leave. When we got our bill they had charged us twice for something we never even got. Good thing we always check our tab. They took the $23 off of the bill and as we were getting ready to go a waiter came up and gave us our food and we declined it. The manager came and gave us a free appetizer card and told us they compensated us on our check but in reality they just took off the food that we never received.

Hoy49kCX6x3xH4jtB9Pp5g.text: The three stars is for the fun vibe and the music.  I think the prices are overpriced if you are not visiting during happy hour.  The rolls I tasted here are not consistent in taste and sometimes sloppy and too much cream cheese but I would return for the RA"CKIN' Shrimp and to enjoy a drink during HH only.

BhHARE1UABswKw7muwg97g.text: I forgot how slow and unfriendly the services is in tukee.  I walked in although four employees were there no one said a word.  I waited 3 minutes not a word so I left and went to living room next door.  Some one who was working said hello and offered to help us find a seat.   Less than 3 minutes I have a 10 dollar drink.  Worth every penny.

s-iPp2W6JUWY3vU5bxI6Uw.text: Hit and miss on service.  Food was good, but took 20 min on order of desert.  Also ordered a beer and it took 15 min for it to hit the table.  Again good food spotty service.

LJtoYxwT2Yl03D6Q0tE0SA.text: My wife wanted try Ra for a while. We had dinner before catching a movie. The server Alicia was prompt, courteous, very knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly. We told her it was our first visit and the manager, James came over to welcome us.   The food was great from the pineapple wontons, to the Viva Las Vegas roll. My wife doesn't eat sushi and had the vegetable roll.  Her words...AHMAZING!! We came back for dessert after our movie. Cinnamon Tempura Gelato...yeah...get that. We will be back for another impromptu date night!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YOhHxTmTlx54a6MstjIHCA.text: Ahi ahi ahi poke. This is where I get my sushi fix. Their Seared Ahi Tuna is very good, its like the NY steak of fish, and here they serve it with avocado and an amazing sauce. The Cali rolls and avocado rolls are good too.

OWRuQdUUySychH-BgCfS4g.text: The restaurant was dirty and messy with food all over the floor. The staff was lazy. Why is the the music so loud!?.. Left, went somewhere else..

Ijy-r9KKMzdb98-Ham1sWg.text: RA is my mine and my boyfriends favorite place to eat. We always have AMAZING servers and they always take the time to chat with us and make sure we are having a pleasant experience. Also a plus that it's right next to the movie theater so we can have a full date night!

8ggCMl1IgjnKPlcojvMH_w.text: Love going here...usually!  Yesterday was an exception.  I loved the Las Vegas rolls and that is what my 2 stars are for but the overall experience was not the best.  Our food took ages to come.  All three miso soups were cold.  We sent them back...one item was missing from our bento box ...our beer for sake was warm...we had to ask for ginger and soy sauce...not good service at all...and they weren't even busy.  Lunch for the three of us was $105 and it was painful parting with that much for a sub-standard  and very disappointing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1HCqX99wssLdRg5s3C-Nxw.text: Ra Sushi is a good place for quick but good sashimi, and sushi. The bento box's are great

3HNsYCDmJktEnYfIZ55Cnw.text: I. Love. It. Here. Absolute favorite place. Good cocktails, fresh sushi, great service. What more can you ask for

e4Wc9GL-dwoTbXii-jPp9A.text: This is our favorite place. We come at least 3/4 times a week to eat or dinner here.  Their food is amazing and all the people that work in here are polite and really nice.  They are really fast at serving your food and always looking if you need something else.  We just love this location that's why we come to this one even if it's far from our house.  The atmosphere is perfect . Our service dog loves all the waitresses here coz they are nice and bring him water.   We recommend this place 100%

RowBjm9Gx9a2NlDYoemx-w.text: The food was good, the service was poor.   I had miso soup, great flavor just excessive green onions. The side salad had tasty dressing, however the lettuce could have been more fresh. We had the veggie tempura, it was all very greasy. The veggies were well cooked and the dipping sauce was tasty. The caterpillar roll was beautifully made, the seaweed element was a little chewy. I didn't have a cocktail, my friends said they enjoyed theirs.   The service was slow. We asked for things but the server was in such a hurry he didn't hear. It makes no sense to get one person's order and not ask the entire table if anyone needs anything else. It took an exceptional amount of time for my friends to get their cocktails. And it took too long to get the check, even after we asked a hostess walking by if we could get it quickly since we were headed to a movie. The server was a very friendly person.   I would go back for the food and because it's close to the theater. If I sat in dining again I would lower my expectations of prompt service.

R94Aft8E65ChDRDpPF8yoA.text: NOT impressed. So even though I ordered a mix of sushi I apparently didn't look like a good patron to them and was treated like crap. I've tried this place a couple of times now just to give them the benefit of the doubt and this last time was the last straw.

pz4AlcwCLMlJpFC0aT3UgA.text: Great service and amazing food. We love coming here because I can get a bento box while my husband can enjoy sushi (I'm not a fan of sushi so I really appreciate somewhere that serves both great food and great sushi).

VlZQUQb4d33ir8mQWx2w6w.text: Food is always consistent. Lobster spring rolls are a delicious appetizer. Favorite sushi roll is the Viva las Vegas. Pomegranate green tea is yummy. Not too pricey. Nice atmosphere and decor.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Must get more

9YEdEBaPzT1YRCNffMLWrQ.text: It was pretty bad overall. We came in around 12:30PM on Sunday and there were only 2 other tables in the place. We felt rushed even though we said we wanted/asked to take our time. The appetizers came our and the waitress immediately returned with our lunch specials. The pineapple cheese wontons hardly had any filling. We paid $8.30 for for of them. I would have been mad even paying $4. We still had food on our plate when the waitress came back and started to clear them. Bye half of my lunch. Next we ordered the fried ice cream for desert and it just seemed dry and crumbly. To top it off when we were asked for the 3rd time if we wanted to pay our bill, as soon as the waitress walked away I was so annoyed so I put down cash and left. The waitress saw us get up to leave and ran to the the table to make sure we weren't dining and dashing. I guess maybe that happens a lot here since the place was overall quite bad. I have been to Ra many times before in Tucson and it was much better. Not sure if this location is just off or if the quality overall at this chain is slipping. Either way we won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plates were dirty before we even started. We should have left then.

5NeCymZOh9EUjDeOZmJe0g.text: I do love ra. In all of its corporate glory. That being said this isn't my favorite location...Mesa or Huntington Beach win that battle every time. But the service is always good (once you get sat...we've had some lengthy waits at the door when the hostess was MIA) and the food is always delicious. They have changed the menu since I was last in (not that long ago)...new prices on some things (I'm lookin at you happy hour menu) but it's not enough to turn me away.   Love or hate corporate sushi, sometimes you just need a Ra Vegas roll (VIVA!!!)

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegas and edamame. They are super quick tonight.

QGZm2wGX8eJ50AtwMQ_3tA.text: Asian cuisine franchises... I hate them!  My friend use to work here as one of the sushi chefs so I was obligated to stop on by to wish him a successful career.  While our buddy took care of us and served us the most beautiful cuts of fish, everything else here is pretty generic.  By all means, the fish is delicious and fresh but for the price, what are we really getting here?  The portions are on the smaller side considering how much you're paying.  Sure the atmosphere is great and the decor is gorgeous but in the end, you're just really paying to say you went to RA.  Even the servers can be a bit on the snobbish uppidy side.  Take your money and support the small local businesses around town!  One positive thing I will say about RA is that I do love the Umami Punch.  Great cocktail to share with a significant other.

oEeX5PQEbRBvqs4-ODMGFw.text: It's unfortunate because we had been there the week before on a Monday and sat at the bar, wonder service and experience but yesterday not so much...  Went to Ra yesterday (Sunday night around 9pm) and there wasn't very many people in the whole place but music was blasting from the bar area. Little obnoxious (just because it's louder doesn't make it better, this isn't Tao). There was no hostess around and finally a waiter took us to the dining area. We asked for a booth and out of the entire dining area, there was one other party and of course we were seated directly behind them and next to the kitchen entrance non the less (lazy seating if you ask me, people don't like to sit next to other people... like in a movie theater). It stunk and the booth seats looked greasy and bits of food left over from the previous party (is this the only booth they use?). We asked to move to a table and we were moved to near the walkway (again, kind of lazy) and there was food all over the floor yet again. So weird because they weren't busy whatsoever. We decided to go elsewhere and on the way out saw the hostess sitting on the counter as she mumbled "goodnight" to us. Maybe she could have vacuumed the place since it was so slow and seemed to be doing nothing else but "stealing a paycheck".  Also the bathroom smelt like a bathroom... not good.   Ra always has good food, I just wish they out more effort into their appearance.

oLjRyHin7wg8lgnbqyuoVQ.text: RA ahwatukee is at it again...  friends wanted to come here for dinner, I vowed never to return after poor service earlier this year, but when your friends want to go, you deal.  We asked for a booth if possible, our hostess walks us around the dining room and we pass an empty booth, it was NOT reserved, it was cleared off, it was wide open...we told her "miss, there is a booth right there." Her response? "Oh that table is like dirty, it can take 5 to 10 minutes to get it ready"  It takes 10 minutes to grab a busser's towel and wipe the table off? It takes 10 seconds, I used to be a busser in high school..the hostess staff is so lazy and pathetic here it's a joke.  This is what RA has come to, just terrible service and lazy out of touch 18 year olds who don't understand life outside of their cell phone...Ra, you disappoint.

75fycLnwoL9dhzP879dg_Q.text: We love Ra! If you go, ask for Nate! He is the best of the best of servers!! If Nate was cloned... the customer service industry would be completely over the top! Nate is always smiling happy to help and never breaks a sweat!!! If you look up happy, fun, loves life, loves everyone in it and completely and utterly passionate...that's Nate!!!   He is the BEST!!

nubQ4fVEiTqwtriFCU1sJw.text: This place used to be way better. Ordered 4 rolls off of the happy hour menu. The quality is just not there anymore, additionally the place was not that busy and after 1 hour we never got 1 roll that we ordered. It was pretty ridiculous to seat there for 1.5 hours and not get a simple 4 roll order?! Never coming back.

mL98vk_jgWbBZcdfjdvKTg.text: Place is cute and servers are nice.  But sushi doesn't taste fresh.  And they skimp on sushli pieces.  So if you aren't a sushi nut like me - you may like it.  For me it's a pass

z4sSatmNHqS4SLGS64cAsQ.text: My friend and I went here for dinner not realizing it was also happy hour.  We decided on the happy hour menu.  I always forget when it's happy hour, and I order a roll, the roll is more rice than usual and smaller portions of fish--the same held True here.  But that was my fault.  The rainbow roll was $8.99, so why not spend a little more and get the non-happy hour rainbow roll with less rice and bigger pieces of fish?  Next time I will.  All in all, the sushi was good as was the tuna tataki (also at the happy hour price).  That was a meal in itself!  I had ordered seaweed salad, but cancelled that when I saw the tuna tataki.  So much food!  Service was excellent--we had Nikki and she acted like she really wanted to be there and that she loved working there.  How refreshing!  I also completed their web survey, so we have a $10 credit when we go back (good for 30 days from our visit).  Love it!

EvoYTTy8q0Xck-Xu6hqnKA.text: I tried the chicken teriyaki bowl on lunch special. It was a good cut of meat but the flavor was just okay. I never had green tea before and wont ever get it again. The miso soup did not mesh well at all with my taste buds. If you are a person who likes fluffy odd raw food and interesting flavors this is your place. If your like me and like red meat, grease, and dairy products this IS NOT YOUR PLACE.   My buddy got a bunch of items from the sushi bar and he liked them.   The service was really good and efficient.  You can easily get a better, cheaper, chicken teriyaki bowl from many other places. Don't go here for that!

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qdpKMwPqgKMezZtfy5Sn6g.text: Tried Ra Sushi for the first time this week and I already want to go back. Highly recommend this place for a family dinner, me and my family shared a number of platters and none of the platters dissapointed. BEST CALAMARI EVER, you definitely have to try it if you go. I hardly order sushi so I wouldn't trust my judgement entirely but I really liked the sushi I had here. Also they definitely aren't stingy with their alcohol, for an $8 drink (we came during happy hour) you might just leave the place a little buzzed. Our waitress and the staff were very exuberant and friendly I'd say 5 stars on customer service. Only recommendation I would give the company based on my experience is to change their chicken teriyaki dish. It needed more flavor and I didn't enjoy the selection of vegetables it came with.

photos.caption: Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of RA Sushi Bar Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. looks good. tastes eh

95IIfqbGwo74WIejzs6w9Q.text: Geo(George) was wonderful with my daughter. I rate a server first by how they treat my kids and by how they treat me. I don't want a server that talks down to, around, or above my but one who treats my kids like a respected customer who happens to be nine years old. We also got to see Geo treat two other much younger and much more out going girls very respectfully, as well, so it was Geo that was exceptional - not *just* my kid

OoVYURB65hb1_bPrO-IgTg.text: This place is so great! I could seriously eat the Ra'ckin roll forever! Our waitress was really nice, and this location is always super clean.

pEFDLSzCASzpFx4lJUxKPQ.text: I give them three stars for being within walking distance, and having a pretty good happy hour food menu. I wouldn't consider trying anything exotic here However, for 2$ salmon nigiri, Ra does a good enough job. The drinks are still pretty expensive, even during happy hour The crowd is full of d-bags, but I usually just ignore them and sit on the patio in my own happy little world :)

XulWee3Hip7tFvLjPvsDtw.text: Love sushi but I cannot claim to be an expert.  I like this place.  Like it dont love it.  Sometimes the sushi is simply amazing. sometimes it just insnt.  They always refill my drink quick which is cool.    This place is kind of pretentious and it really shouldnt be. Yes it is upscale and overpriced but it is in Ahwatukee on the border of Tempe.  Not N. Scottsdale.  Its fun though. I really enjoy myself when I go and it is not bad for meeting some people of all kinds at and around the bar.  Staff is filled with hot chicks but the bartender who is the manager also can turn the music up WAY too loud.  She kind of gives the tough shit look to the custies.  Good social spot, ok food.

nDbaERcTu10RmFofguSKkw.text: Great Sushi, great drinks, great service and most of all -great staff!   After a couple of visits -the staff miraculously remembers what you and your friends ordered to drink or eat!  I was meeting a friend there so I ordered my drink and the service connoisseur asked what my guest would like and I couldn't remember what he drank!  She asked me if he had been there before with me and I said yes -and began to describe him amongst the group that was with us last time --she immediately said "oh yes, he had a "drink name here" and said she would bring him a cold one to be ready for when he arrives"......amazing -I still can't remember what he drank -but the fact that she remembers you when you come in -and can remember you if you aren't even there yet....that's what I call excellent service and a True connection with your customers!

8FScRFETfozBRwlZV98usg.text: I'm updating my review...because...well, this is just disappointing. I've been a huge fan of RA for the past 5+ years. I just feel like the quality/quantity is decreasing and the prices are increasing. I understand it's a tough economy...but they just lost two loyal customers. This past time my husband and I went, he could have sworn the rice was different on the rolls (I couldn't really tell a difference but he didn't like it) and I know this is small to most people, but they don't have the low-sodium soy sauce anymore. We tried the regular soy sauce and just did a tiny bit, but it was so salty and overpowering, that we couldn't really enjoy our rolls. The whole experience was underwhelming, and I think we'll just go to Ninja Sushi next time.

LdwxVd8noQU0axFshxZfpw.text: Love this place! sushi is great and sake bomber is awesome! Happy hour is the best!! service is great too...Try it out during happy hour its worth it!

Ywmx66LhU3A1aJhylPCd5g.text: This place is always one of the first places my husband and I go to, once we are in a city that has one. Having lived in Phoenix for around 10 years, this has always been one of my favorites. Recently they have added new rolls and sushi to their menu, and I must say, Great job!

E91Wre5SLyVEIln_dO5Hrw.text: Mediocre food and poor service. Went in there today for lunch and the server brought me the wrong drink, and it took him 10 minutes to come back to fix it. He brought me the right order, but nobody offered to refill my drinks or even see how the meal was. Finally, when I asked about dessert, he disappeared for another 10 minutes and told me not to bother because it had freezer burn. I won't be back.

V7l7Tvws3gQOYV4gapV9cg.text: Stopped here very quickly for some appetizers: shishito peppers and the garlic citrus yellowtail.  Strawberry lemonade for the drink...service was great and the food exceptionally fresh!  I've been here before this time and will continue to return.  Lots to try on the menu!

L6HB5hpoeRINrrXythVWSQ.text: I really only go here during happy hour.  I like the Tsunami Punch, vegetable tempura, calamari, pot stickers, Saki Bombers, California Roll, Tootsie Maki.  It's impossible to have a conversation with someone due to the loud music.

9PiSbWj-2eiKK34XzFzwlg.text: The sushi was good (I only tried 2 rolls). The wine selection was GREAT! The service was good, and the price was a bit high. Over all I enjoyed my experience at RA. The only 2 negatives were, the women's bathroom was being remodeled so I had to used the men's....eeeewh, and it was FREEZING! For some reason the AC was on at 8 pm at night and it was cold outside. We asked them to turn it off because it was blowing right on our table and no one ever did. Since I was literally shivering I did not get to enjoy my experience as much as I would have liked. I really just wanted to go relax and chat with my friends after work, but I think I burned just as many calories sitting there freezing my ars off as I would have if I had gone to the gym. I'll go back when it is hot outside again.

MyQpajHsPAcnnsoLbiRchA.text: This place needs a face-lift, the whole concept and decor is outdated and needs some help. I think their sushi and other food items are alright, although they try to be so trendy and in reality there menu is pretty blah. Its a fun place to grab a drink and sit on the patio, but the excitement and trendiness of this place is completely gone.

KngQFVnmj2bb_bfiSmV0uw.text: Really cool ambiance if you are looking for a trendy spot. Food is good and pretty consistent.

IOFbROpCHlH8swym1uTihg.text: I've only been to this Ra once or twice, but I think the price is overestimated here.  Maybe people are having too much Sake.  The service is decent, ambiance is very faux Japanese-American deal.  Sushi is pretty good and if you go during happy hour it's a steal.  Sake and Kirin is like 3 or 4 bucks and you can get a thing of Sake for $1.  They have a nice patio sitting area to people watch. Great place if you want to catch a friend for lunch or do dinner and a movie.

MioHCeo9uQ2A8v8Ya4pslQ.text: Great food, the Crunchy Calamari roll is my fav! Other good ones are the Dragon, Viva Las Vegas and Caterpillar rolls!

_KtanoltzwvCG_o0osgEjA.text: This is a decent happy hour spot.  I go here occasionally with a group of my girlfriends (ages 20s and 30s) and we reserve one of the big corner booths.  Sushi is good, drinks are excellent.  Bill is usually around $30.  Service is decent.

481Y2_VDbFfNQTEaeTuGkw.text: The Vegas roll was amazing, and the coconut creme brulee was excellent. Brittany is an excellent server, the best food and service I've had in the three weeks that I've been visiting Phoenix.

7h-8PZ7ILP7U9N9mlyddvQ.text: Great Happy hour!  Love th Miso Soup and the overall atmosphere!  Great plum wine too!

IynQU3XUC6sd0qKfmkCbFg.text: Went to RA last night. Their happy hour has always been one of our favorites. We showed up to find that corporate has decided to butcher the happy hour. Not only were the selections minimal, the quality seemed to suffer greatly as well.  We won't be back, especially with all of the other great happy hours in the area. Nice move corporate! Let's see how that one works out for you.

k6P0umI8q1uiOIusGbz6Zw.text: Food is barely average and going down hill fast. Service is not great but they try. But they might think of asking the waitress to shower once in a while. Gross.
